data.job_description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.

As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.

So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you

Ideal Candidate
• Fluent in English.
• Excellent research skills.
• Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
• Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Australia.
• Analytical mindset.

Job Requirements
• Must be living in Australia for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
• Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
• Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
• Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
• Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
• All work must be of an independent nature.

Technical requirements to perform the work

Access to a laptop or computer which uses:
- A logon account unique to you
- Anti-virus solution that is kept up to date, with regular scans performed
- Only one member per household may apply
NB. All products should be provided at your own expense.

Benefits

· Work up to 20 hours per week.
· Earn a competitive rate of pay.
· Develop your research skills.
· Avoid the long commute.
· Work from the comfort of your home office.
· Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours

Apply Online Today

This is a freelance, independent contractor position.
Additional information: Remote Job: Fully in-personEmployment type: Part-time

data.job_title: Expressions of Interest - Data Analyst, Data & Analytics
data.job_description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

If we inspire you to do the work you love, will you still call it work?

What's in it for you?

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our EY Data and Analytics team ideally in our Melbourne and Sydney offices but can also be based in any of the major Australian cities. Working with a number of high profile clients this role is offered on a flexible, full-time basis.

You will help shape, change, and deliver a data management roadmap to improve and enhance the value and re-usability of data, through modern and evolving data management practices and frameworks.

As a Data Analyst, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives, you will work with a diverse range of stakeholders and data teams to uplift the current data quality management capabilities of a number of different high profile client groups.

We are open to candidates located in Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, Perth or Canberra for this role.

What we're looking for
• Translating business questions to data and analysis requirements; carry out analysis, visualization and presentation.
• Performing ad-hoc analysis to solve business problems and support decisions.
• Design and build data products, such as Power BI dashboards, including defining the data models.
• Surfacing and sharing insights, typically from internal corporate data, using a dashboard.
• Run human centred design sessions with end-users.
• Communicating and influencing stakeholders.
• Coaching non-data experts how to use data.

Skills and attributes for success
• Experience in a hands-on role interpreting and telling stories with data.
• Curious and business outcome focused with an ability to break down a complex problem and work out how to solve it.
• Evidence of numerical and technical aptitude strong collaboration skills having worked with business stakeholders at different levels of seniority.
• Comfortable working across a wide range of data sets and systems:
• Expertise in cleansing, combining and processing data.
• Have knowledge of SQL, with knowledge of Python an advantage.
• Familiarity with Power BI and ideally data manipulation tools (e.g. Alteryx and Daraiku).

What we can offer you
• Explore how a career at EY is yours to build at www.ey.com/au/careerdevelopment
• Discover how, when and where you can work at www.ey.com/au/flexibility
• Learn about our commitment to DE&I at www.ey.com/au/diversity-inclusiveness
• Understand how our benefits can support you at www.ey.com/au/benefits

Acknowledgement of Country

EY acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which EY offices are located around Australia. We pay our respects to their cultures, and to their Elders — past, present, and emerging. Find out more about our vision for reconciliation at www.ey.com/au/reconciliation

Apply now… we’re over 9,000 perspectives in Australia and we’re ready to welcome yours.

At EY we take inclusivity seriously, and we’re committed to removing barriers and improving the employment prospects of people with disability or long-term health conditions. We encourage you to share any support and adjustments you need to be your best and participate equitably in our recruitment process. We understand sharing your needs with us can be daunting, so if you have questions before or during your application, we welcome you to get in touch at contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or +61 3 8650 7788 (option 2). Anything you tell us will be kept completely confidential.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider. Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $90,000 including 11% superannuation.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

The Opportunity

We have an exciting opportunity for a Health & Safety Data Analyst to come and join our team. In this role, you will support the development of the Power BI dashboard and coordinate monthly Health &Safety performance data and reporting on trends analysis in corporate reporting.

Key responsibilities:
• Support the development and analysis of health & safety performance data across the ACCIONA Group. This involves collecting, analysing and interpreting data to identify trends, insights and areas for improvement.
• Create and maintain Power BI dashboards and prepare group monthly reports.
• Critically evaluate and analyse information across multiple sources, reconcile conflicts and resolve or escalate to relevant stakeholders.
• Effectively communicate data insights to the business and work with key stakeholders to ensure that insights are being effectively utilised to drive business value.
• Conduct project Audits verifying the quality of data being provided is in line with ACCIONA requirements.
• Assist data integration projects between different system tools.

About You:
• Commercial experience gained in a similar and construction experience would be highly desirable however not essential.
• Demonstrated Reporting and Business Analyst experience, or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and/or education/training.
• Demonstrated skills in Power BI. Intermediate Power BI skills.
• PL-300 Microsoft Data Analyst Associate Certification is desirable.
• Qualifications in Work Health and Safety, Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, Economics, Information Systems, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or related discipline is desirable.

Junior Data Analyst
• Hybrid and Flexible Work Environment
• Work for the worlds largest privately owned insurance broker
• Excellent opportunity for someone to build a career in a growing company

Are you looking to kick-start your career in the business intelligence and data analytics sector? We are searching for someone that will want to own the technical design, development and delivery of business intelligence systems, reports and analysis for a growing division across Australia. If this sounds like you, we have an excellent career growth opportunity for a graduate to join our Employee Benefits team in our Melbourne office, and we want to hear from you!

About Arsenault

Since our foundation in 1966, Arsenault has grown to become the worlds largest privately owned insurance broker. The Arsenault company structure has produced a unique culture where we empower our Associates to think independently. With a 98% client retention rate in Australia and leading expertise across insurance and risk management, we now have over 160 staff located in Perth, Melbourne, Brisbane, Hobart, Adelaide, Auckland, Hamilton and Christchurch.

What will you be doing?
• Developing and maintaining a SQL based reporting platform
• Managing and developing data integration pipelines, data storage structures and data cleansing
• Gathering data requirements, documentation and end to end testing
• Gathering, clarifying and documenting requirements and designing solutions
• Data product design, development, and maintenant for visualisations, reports, dashboards, and data insights
• Interpreting data and analysing results using statistical techniques to create monthly reports
• Serving internal clients and ensuring accurate, on time delivery of monthly reporting

To be successful in this role, you will need to:
• Have great communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills
• Have the ability to learn quickly and take initiative
• Be capable of following directions and working collaboratively with others, while simultaneously also be self-motivated
• Build relationships with various stakeholders in a robust office environment

You will need the following experience and qualifications:
• Bachelor of Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Science or a related discipline
• Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
• Knowledge of SQL Server (data profiling and querying) and VBA
• Knowledge of Azure, Power BI, R, Python is an asset, we will train the right candidate
• Experience using Git source control is an asset
• Experience with project coordination and management is an asset

We offer:
• An agile/hybrid work environment
• A focus on training and development opportunities and mentoring program
• Discounted corporate private health insurance and a free flu vaccination program
• Salary Continuance insurance to protect you and your family in the event you suffer an illness or injury
• Paid parental leave and volunteer leave
• Access to Uprise employee assistance program including coaching and counselling
• Social activities and community engagement organized by our new wellness committee

Arsenault is an equal opportunity employer. We strongly encourage applications from people of all backgrounds, ages, religions, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, LGBTIQ+ people, those with a disability, women and people with a cultural or linguistically diverse background.

About the Opportunity:

Kinetic IT have recently partnered with a major Federal Government department to provide Enterprise Service Management and provide a comprehensive range of IT Service Management and SIAM practices across the organisation!

We are now on the lookout for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team to further enhance our service integration and management capabilities.

About you:

Your expertise in data visualisation and continuous improvement recommendations will ensure our stakeholders will be making informed decisions, identifying opportunities for improvement and driving continual service enhancement within the SIAM ecosystem. You will play a vital role in collecting, analysing and presenting performance data to support data-driven decision making. You will also be supporting root cause analysis during major incidents and assisting in trend forecasting and SLA compliance analysis.

Day to day your duties will include:
• Ensuring data accuracy, completeness and consistency within the SIAM ecosystem
• Cleaning and pre-processing of data, ensuring it is ready for analysis.
• Creating reporting frameworks (dashboards, scorecards and periodic reports) to present performance data to senior leaders
• Root cause analysis
• Designing of data collection methods to gather performance data from various service providers and create a comprehensive view of service performance.

Sound like a role for you? You’ll need some of the following:
• Hold ACTIVE status & maintain a minimum Government Security Clearance
• Experience with data analytics in an ITIL-aligned enterprise environment
• Experience in ServiceNow and ServiceNow dashboards and reporting solutions
• High level technical writing (for processes and framework design), reporting and documentation skills.
• Cognos reporting
• Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio, SQL Server Data Tools and/ or Visual Studio Reporting Services
• Microsoft Power Pivot, Excel, Performance Analytics
• Experience performing data extraction from data warehouses.
• Experience writing SQL Queries

The Kinetic IT Difference
• Flexible working, paid parental leave, and other benefits tailored to your individual goals.
• Regular fun company and social events – Sundowner, Family Fun Day, Quiz Night and End of Year Party
• Vendor Exam Support, ITIL V4 Training and Communities of Practice groups
• Dedicated professional development reviews every 6 months, with monthly follow ups
• An open and supportive culture where we respect all people and individuals, and everyone has a voice

About KineticIT

We are recognised market leaders in the delivery of high-quality technology solutions to large public, private, and government organisations. As an Australian-owned company, we take a lot of pride in delivering exceptional service that exceeds our customers’ expectations and positively contributing to our industry and community. We hire for the long term and have a strong focus on training and developing our employees. Everyday our amazing 1,300+ crew come to Kinetic IT not just to work but to be challenged, grow and be part of something bigger.

Check out more at kineticit.com.au

How To Apply

First, check out our website Kineticit.com.au. If you like what you see then, click on the ‘Apply’ button or contact our careers account on careers@kineticit.com.au and quote ‘data analyst’

Job Description

Location: Melbourne | CBD

Job type: Full time

Organisation: Victorian Legal Services Board and Commissioner

Salary: $116,552 - $127,621

Occupation: Technology

Reference: VG/1754290

Flexibility – Culture – Well-being – Partnership – Purpose

Can you tell me more about what you do at VLSB+C?

Great question! We're really proud of the work we do. We are the regulator of the Victorian legal profession. We license lawyers and oversee service standards and conduct. This includes handling complaints about lawyers, investigating poor conduct and overseeing management of trust accounts. We are also the stewards of the public purpose and fidelity funds and administer these to support legal regulation and access to justice in Victoria.

We are a modern best practice regulator, using data and insights to help identify where our actions can have the greatest impact on ensuring ethical and professional legal practice by Victorian lawyers. We are passionate about maintaining and protecting the rule of law by ensuring the integrity of the legal profession.

What role are you recruiting for?

We're looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Data & Insights Team. You will focus on providing technical expertise in statistical and data analytics to increase the efficiency and accuracy of regulatory, compliance, and educational programs.

What type of person are you looking for?

We are looking for candidates with the following

Relevant qualification in information technology, S.T.E.M., statistics, data science / business analysticsor economics / econometrics or relevant experience

Experience in data analytics methodologies, techniques and analytics software

Experience in programming languages, statistical, data visualisation programs and reporting software

How are you different from other organisations?

We offer:

Flexibility: We have work leading edge flexible working options including part-time, compressed hours, flexible start time, up to 3 days working from home.

Culture: Our culture results are better than the wider VPS by an average of 10%

Well-being: We have an active Social Club and Health and Wellbeing Committee that promote fun and engaging activities throughout the year

Partnership: our horizontal structure allows for more partnership with your colleagues and other teams

Purpose: We play a key role in regulating the legal practice in Victoria

I want to know more!

Alex Codoreanu would love to hear from you on 03 7039 8407 if you have questions about the role.

I'm now really interested!

Our recruitment is all about red carpet not red tape so simply click on ‘Apply Now' before midnight 22nd October.

Please note that a Codility test will be planned for pre selected candidates and a work task during interview.

Other relevant information:

Appointment will be subject to abiding by our Flexible Working Procedure which defines the number of required in-office days at Level 5, 555 Bourke Street (including the ‘team day' of your team) and completion of both the VPS Pre-Employment Statutory Declaration, Misconduct Declaration and Consent Form and the Pre-Employment Health Declaration.

Your appointment may be subject to a satisfactory National Police Record Check, provision of evidence of qualifications required for your position and/or a probation period.

VLSB+C is committed to equal employment opportunity, ethical practice, diversity, inclusion and providing reasonable adjustments for persons with disabilities.

If you have any questions or need assistance to fully participate in the process, please contact People and Culture on 03 9679 8073 or peopleandculture@lsbc.vic.gov.au

Overview
This role is responsible for driving the delivery of data solutions to internal and external stakeholders. This is a broad-ranging role, including understanding the business requirements, data modelling, data profiling/analysis, design data solution (data flow), preparing technical documentation, production support, data mapping and data reconciliation and other support needs as required.
• Multiple Day rate contract roles finishing end of March 2024 or June 2024.
• Flexible location: Melbourne CBD or Parramatta

Key Accountabilities and main responsibilities
Strategic Focus
• Analyse Business Requirement Documents to identify technical solutions in consultation with the Feature Engineers considering all databases, application, business process and system implications.
• Consult with clients (new/potential) to discuss requirements and provide appropriate data solutions for product delivery.

Operational Management
• Liaise with key Business Stakeholders to provide expertise, and to seek clarification on, Business Requirements.
• Investigate, gather and document requirements for enhancements to Systems. Ensure data mapping master documents are maintained.
• Provide specialist expertise on a specification design criteria to developers for all supported Systems.
• Arrange and chair Business and Technical meetings, where required, to facilitate technical solution outcomes.
• Complete Functional Specifications and/or Technical Specifications
• Complete Traceability matrixes as part of Solution Design alignment with Business Requirements and other IT delivery teams, as required.
• Perform peer review and sign-off of business and technical SDLC deliverables for other team members where appropriate.
• Accurate and regular time and task recording to ensure effort expended on tasks can be monitored and reported against.
• Investigate and consult on pragmatic alternatives for short, medium- and long-term solutions to a problem.
• Be proactive in identifying and implementing improvements to processes and procedures within the team and greater IT group.
• Work and collaborate with third and/or vendor parties to deliver integrated system solutions.
• Logging and accessing technical solutions within the JIRA database and thoroughly documenting the status of all client liaisons and communications.

People Leadership
• Mentor members of the team
• Work closely with Development and Operations team

Governance & Risk
• Escalate any behaviour or conduct in breach of our Code of Conduct is as appropriate
• Complied with all relevant legal obligations and adhere to Link Group policies and procedures
• Report all incidents of non-conformity, noncompliance and unethical behaviour immediately to your manager
• Complete all allocated compliance training by the due date

Experience & Personal Attributes
• Minimum 2 years of demonstrable competency as Technical Analyst or equivalent role (Min. 10 years for Senior Systems Analyst)
• Working knowledge and application of SQL
• Knowledge and skills sets associated with extracting, gathering and combining data for data analysis and data profiling activities
• Ability to analyse large amount of data and provide feedback and recommendations to stakeholders
• Excellent analytical and problem solving skills and ability to drive operational and business transformations as needed
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including presentation skills
• Excellent time management and good prioritisation skills
• Sound understanding of IT application and system design best practice

Full Job Description
$90K - $100K + Super + Salary Packaging
Location: Melbourne, Sydney or remote
Use data to make a positive impact

Data & Insights Analyst - Fundraising & Marketing
Salary: $90K - $100K + Super + Salary packing
Location: Melbourne, Sydney or remote
Opportunities to continually advance your Data Analytics career.
We are seeking candidates with a strong background in proven data and data insights expertise. This role goes beyond merely aggregating data into basic tabular reports; it involves the ability to comprehend and present insights in a compelling manner. These insights will not only significantly impact the donor experience but also go beyond seeking new financial opportunities. We are looking for individuals who are actively dedicated to enhancing our business offerings.

About the role…

In this role, you will be tasked with pioneering innovative approaches to harness consumer behavioural data. Your goal is to derive descriptive and prescriptive insights that will guide optimal decision-making. Additionally, you will be responsible for creating interactive and automated dashboards that empower our fundraising team to make strategic decisions through proactive in-depth analysis and insights.

Key responsibilities…

Build and Provide insights for the individual giving team in fundraising.
Develop subject matter expertise in the various channels used by the individual giving team.
Engage with business users to consult and recommend best possible way to answer their business data questions.
Provide rapid answers to business questions using a mix of queries and visualisations.
Support ad hoc data requests from across business areas.
Design and build reporting data models that support user self-serve reporting.
Identify data to integrate with the warehouse to develop actionable insights to drive business decisions.
Build customer segmentation analytics and campaign performance reporting.
Proactively organising training and development activities for business to facilitate adaption.
Design, build, test and present meaningful insights from a complex range of data.

Skills and experience

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, economics, or a related field.
3-5 years of experience in data analytics, business intelligence, or related field.
1-2 years’ experience working with fundraising teams
Experience with data visualisation and querying tools such as Power BI and SQL.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Knowledge of data modelling, data warehousing, and ETL processes.
Strong ability to work in T-SQL and DAX queries.
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience in developing and maintaining reports, dashboards, and visualisations.
Knowledge of fundraising and marketing analytics and metrics.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.

More about the role…

Furthermore, you will play a vital role in supporting the enhancement of consumer engagement strategies and product-specific initiatives. Leveraging technical solutions and advanced analytics, you will be at the forefront of developing ground breaking solutions for consumer profiling and segmentation.
Through your work in extracting insights from diverse data sources, you will drive strategic and operational initiatives. These initiatives will lead to increased revenue, improved efficiency, cost optimisation, and an elevated supporter experience, ultimately contributing to the organisation's success and sustainable growth.

A little about our client…

Mission Australia, a renowned national charity with over 160 years of dedicated service, is on a mission to help vulnerable Australians find their path to independence. They are committed to tackling homelessness, supporting struggling families, addressing mental health challenges, and fighting substance dependencies. Mission Australia thrives on the support of everyday Australians, corporate partners, and a passionate team of professionals.

Next step is to APPLY…

Ready to embark on an epic journey where your data skills make a real difference? Send us your application, including a cover letter and resume, send it through Beaumont People now! Join Mission Australia and become a data wizard on a mission to end homelessness and help communities thrive! Apply now and be part of something truly magical!

Don’t tick all the boxes? That’s okay, we like thinking outside the box. We value skills, passion, and drive. So, if this job resonates with you, we want to hear from you! If you would like to have a confidential chat, please contact Jack or Dean on 02 9133 9322 or email dean@beaumontpeople.com.au

Beaumont People believe a diverse workplace is a happy workplace, and we love working with organisations that feel the same way. We encourage applications from people of all different backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from CALD backgrounds and people with disabilities. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital or parental status. Should you require a reasonable accommodation to be made for your application to be assessed we would be more than happy to discuss how that can be arranged.

About ViVi

Vivi is the only wireless screen mirroring and digital signage tool designed for education. We enable K-12 organizations to realize more value from their existing investments in display technology and student devices, by providing more consistent and reliable experiences for students, teachers and staff to connect, communicate and collaborate.

Vivi exists because we all had that one teacher who changed our lives, who went above and beyond to serve as a role model and sage. They guided discussion, connected with their students on a personal level, were just as engaging and entertaining as they were educational, and they created a dynamic learning environment by constantly involving students.

Personalized learning environments have been proven to deliver better educational outcomes for individuals through increased participation and engagement. To successfully create such an environment requires a fluid, visual dialogue between teacher and student. This is why Vivi exists. 

Vivi is used by over 500,000 teachers and students in more than 90,000 classrooms around the world and is setting out to disrupt the enormous education industry with our high-growth, ambitious, and creative team.

What You’ll Be Doing
• Building and maintaining production level data pipelines using various tools such as AWS Glue, Python, Lambda etc. that populate business critical dashboards as needed
• Performing data analysis as required, and promptly preparing reports with the findings/results
• Building custom analyses, reports, dashboards using tools in Vivi’s BI stack
• Building/maintaining components of the Data Warehouse as per the Architecture using CI/CD
• Implementing the BI Data Quality Framework
• Supporting the business stakeholders with ad hoc BI and data requests
• Working with internal customers, Engineering, Product and support teams to prioritise requests and reports
• Identifying opportunities to establish/improve the processes and practices
• Creating relevant documentation as required

About You

About The Role

The Data and Analytics Lead is a strategic role responsible for actionable, high impact analytics and insights that enable an irresistible experience for our people, and continuously drive achievement of our People Plan and business goals.

Company Description

illion is the leading independent provider of trusted data and analytics products and services in Australia and New Zealand. illion leverages its consumer and commercial credit registries to provide end-to-end customer management solutions to clients in the financial services, telecommunications, utilities and government sectors.

Job Description

Your new role and how you’ll make a difference

Are you ready for your next career move in finance and want autonomy and freedom to develop your experience quickly across all areas of the P&L.

FP&A at illion operates through an integrated business partner approach, working with the business to provide commercial insight into historical and future results that will enable the management team to make better business decisions. This is done through closely collaborating with business partners to understand the core drivers of business performance and develop relevant metrics and timely reports that measure, monitor and report on performance.

This key role within finance will also work with financial and non-financial systems (e.g. TM1, Great Plains, Salesforce and proprietary systems) to create integrated KPI and finance reporting for management and the board. You will need to be willing to get your hands dirty in systems interrogation and report building to be successful.

The value-add things you’ll be doing
• Support the Head of FP&A and GM Finance by working with key stakeholders to understand key business drivers of sales, revenue and opex and use this knowledge to identify future opportunities and issues so that appropriate action can be taken in advance
• Identify trends and model future impacts and outcomes
• Ad-hoc financial analysis where required
• KPI reporting and interpretation as leading and lagging indicators of financial performance
• Sales and Revenue reporting by Customer & Product
• Assist the business to understand and interpret the financial information in the system and reports to enable management to plan, evaluate, control and enhance performance of their areas of responsibility in the business.
• Support the business in the use of the system through developing relevant, system driven dashboard and management accounting reports that can be readily accessed and understood by the business managers.
• Preparation of the monthly management pack.

Qualifications

The experience and qualifications you’ll need to be successful
• Cognos TM1 experience highly regarded
• Budgeting & Forecasting Experience
• Great Plains Experience
• Salesforce.com experience
• Budgeting & Forecasting Experience
• Sales and technology business partnering
• 2+ years business partnering/finance experience with exposure to planning and forecasting
• CPA, CA or equivalent
• Cognos TM1 experience or similar highly regarded
• Able to explain complex finance concepts and data in simple, commercial terms
• Advanced excel skills including financial modelling
• Ability to analyse large data sets and translate the data into meaningful messages, action items and communications (verbal, written and numerical)

Additional Information

Some of our perks
• Flexibility and Remote Working Options
• Gifted Leave, Purchased Leave, Public Holiday Swap and Paid Volunteer Leave
• Paid Parental Leave
• Novated Leasing and Corporate Discounts (ie. Health Insurance)
• Education Assistance and dedicated time for professional development as part of your role
• Free Employee Assistance Programme, Free Flu Shots and Subsidised Gym Memberships.

illion’s values

Wonder what if

We wonder on many levels. About ideas. And about how others see them. We listen with curiosity. Obsess the numbers. And embrace new ways to make data, make a difference

We’re good eggs

Everything we do is built on integrity. We hold ourselves to high standards. And higher principles. We act with good intentions. Taking every opportunity to be that little bit better.

Human. Kind

People are the hart of our products, processes and culture. Our relationships are a gift. We’re inclusive. Measuring the impact of our actions on other’s first. Kindness and humanity prevail.

We all add up

We work wonders when we work together. Our diverse perspectives and backgrounds make us greater than the sum of our parts. We’re one team, where every single one of us counts.

How to Apply

To apply, please click “Apply Now” button and we will be in touch shortly.

Due to the sensitive data that illion works with, employment at illion is subject to employees having full working rights for Australia and/or New Zealand and successful completion of a Criminal Record Check.

Here at illion, we value diversity and inclusion and believe that we are able to grow and learn better together with a diverse team of employees. By joining illion you'll be part of an inclusive culture that celebrates a diversity of cultures, skill sets, educations and opinions. People from all culturally diverse backgrounds including Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

• Join a collaborative team and deliver great employee experiences.
• Experience Hybrid working arrangements in a flexible environment
• Permanent role based in either Melbourne or Sydney

We're REA

REA Group is not your average digital business. From humble beginnings in a garage in Melbourne’s east in 1995, we have grown into a leading global digital business, specialising in property.

With bold and ambitious goals, we are changing the way the world experiences property. No matter where you're at on your property journey, we're here to help with every step - whether that's finding or financing your next home.

Our people are the key to our success. At the heart of everything we do, is a thriving culture centred around high performance and care. We are purpose driven and collaborative, which drives innovation and our ability to make a real impact. As such, we’re proud to be named in Australia’s “Top 5” Best Workplaces two years in a row, as well as being recognised as a Best Workplace for Women.

Where the team fits in

The Data and Insights Analyst sits within the People & Culture team, headed up by Mary Lemonis,

Chief People and Sustainability Officer. From building management capability and the next

generation of leaders, to creating a diversity and inclusion strategy which is mainstreamed and

embedded into everything we do – the People & Culture team is all about making REA Group a great place to work. Supporting our multi-national business with HR processes, policies and systems to meet the needs of our people around the world, the team works to build high engagement with our impressive offering of programs and benefits.

What The Role Is All About

We are looking for a technically focussed Data and Insights Analyst who is passionate about People data and insights. You’ll be supporting the People & Culture team with key employee life cycle activities related to our specialist functions of Remuneration, Payroll and Work Health and Safety. You’ll contribute your subject matter expertise and work with a wide a range of activities and stakeholders.
• Working closely with our Remuneration Manager, managing job evaluations, equity administration and cyclical rem processes like year end reviews and market data submissions, ensuring an efficient process, up to date information and fit for purpose solutions
• Reviewing and supporting current WHS processes and policies, and determining what potential efficiencies can be made using technology and effective collaboration with key stakeholders
• Assisting with payroll reporting, in particular making the best use of our new payroll reporting functionality in the Ramco payroll system.
• Using modelling, statistics, trend analysis, and other data analysis techniques to collect, explore, identify, and analyse data.

Who We’re Looking For
• Intermediate to advanced Excel skills
• Super strong attention to detail
• Strong background and demonstrated experience in reporting and analytics, data science, continuous improvement
• General problem-solving skills and ability to think creatively
• Work productively in a fast-paced environment
• Relevant qualification associated with data and analytics will be preferable
• Data Analytics - using modeling, statistics, trend analysis, and other data analysis techniques to collect, explore, identify, and analyze data.
• Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal and the sensitivity to understand audience needs and adapt style accordingly
• Translating business requirements into clear, concise, testable and accurate user stories & process flows;
• Time management and prioritisation
• Experience working with HR/ People analytics
• Experience with Workday & Ramco is advantageous but not essential
• Broad knowledge and understanding of people management principles and practices
• Ability to work independently and cooperatively with business and technical resources

The REA Experience

The physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our people is something we’ll never stop caring about. This is a place to learn and grow. We’re committed to your development – both professionally and personally. Your experience with us is something we take seriously.

We offer:
• A hybrid and flexible approach to working - https://rea.to/hybrid-working
• Flexible parental leave offering for primary and secondary carers
• Programs to support mental, emotional, financial and physical health & wellbeing
• Our Because We Care program offers employees volunteering leave, community grants, matched payroll giving and our Community Café donates 100% of revenue to charity.
• Hack Days so you can bring your big ideas to life
• Performance recognition programs because hard work should never go unnoticed

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We believe teams with diverse ideas and experiences are more creative, more eﬀective and fuel disruptive thinking - be it cultural and ethnic backgrounds, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, or any other identity or lived experience. We know diverse teams are critical to maintaining our success and driving new business opportunities. If you've got the skills, dedication and enthusiasm to learn but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch.

If you like the sound of us, then we think you should apply today. We're proud to be Circle Back Initiative Employer and we commit to respond to every applicant. While we're looking at your application, and preparing to come back to you with an update, why not get to know us a bit more through our various social channels?

Work options: Hybrid

The purpose of Customer Insights and Reporting team is to support the entire OnePass business by enabling more sophisticated uses of data across OnePass and our partnering Divisions. This team is responsible for establishing a self-service reporting capability within the business, for designing, building and maintaining reports to support management and operational decision making, and for responding to ad-hoc analysis needs. This team is also responsible for designing advanced analytical solutions to business or customer problems and working with domain teams to deploy these solutions.

What You’ll Be Doing

We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Senior Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be responsible for collecting, analysing, and interpreting complex data sets to extract valuable insights and drive data-informed decision-making. Your expertise in data manipulation, statistical analysis, and data visualisation will contribute to the success of OnePass by identifying trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data-driven initiatives and deliver actionable recommendations. The ideal candidate is passionate about data, possesses strong analytical skills, and is comfortable working in a fast-paced and evolving environment.

Key Duties And Deliverables
• Acquire and cleanse large and diverse data sets from various sources to ensure data integrity and quality.
• Apply statistical techniques and data mining methods to extract meaningful insights from complex data sets.
• Conduct exploratory data analysis and identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
• Create clear and concise visualisations, dashboards, and reports to present data-driven insights to stakeholders.
• Develop interactive dashboards using data visualisation tools to facilitate understanding and exploration of data.
• Collaborate with team members to create automated reports and streamline data analysis processes.
• Monitor and evaluate key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess the effectiveness of business processes and strategies.
• Identify areas for improvement and provide recommendations based on data analysis findings.
• Work closely with stakeholders to define and track performance metrics aligned with business objectives.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data requirements and provide analytical support.
• Translate complex data findings into actionable insights and recommendations.
• Contribute to strategic planning by leveraging data insights to identify business opportunities and risks.
• Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and compliance with data governance policies.
• Develop and implement data validation procedures to identify and resolve data quality issues.
• Stay updated with industry best practices and emerging trends in data analytics and data management.

Key Relationships

Reports To

Reporting and Analytics Lead

What you will need
• Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline.
• Proven work experience as a Data Analyst or similar role in a product-driven organization (3+ years)
• Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with data querying from databases.
• Proficiency in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
• Experience with statistical analysis, A/B testing, and data modelling techniques.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
• Excellent communication and presentation skills to convey complex data insights to diverse audiences.
• Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and influence decision-making.
• Familiarity with product management methodologies and product development lifecycle.
• Knowledge of web analytics and tag management tools (e.g., Google Analytics/Adobe/Tealium)
Equipment / Technology used
• Corporate Office desktop operating environments
• Snowflake
• Kafka
• Google Analytics
• Power BI
• Tealium
• Confluence & JIRA
• Miro & Murali

Why OneDigital?
• Working in a community of industry-leading innovators with a diverse and deep set of skills and experience, you will learn, collaborate, and co-create to achieve great things.
• You’ll have ownership of your role, which will allow you to find the right balance between stretch and sustainability, work, and life.
• Culture of comradery and collaboration - OneTeam
• Plus, all the tools and learning you need, the tone is set for you to shine and succeed.
• We know that diversity fosters greater innovation and better customer connection, so we strive to create a team where everyone feels like they belong. We support diversity, inclusion and we are a gender-neutral organisation. We celebrate individuals at their core, so they shine to their best.

Team Benefits – just to name a few!

To support you at work, what you value in life and in the community, our team member benefits include:
• Access to the latest technologies
• An annual budget for your learning and development (this includes learning of your choice, certifications and more)
• Extended parental leave (16 weeks for primary carers), and paid volunteer days
• Flexible working – we balance working together with working flexibly
• People-focussed culture that celebrates achievements big and small
• Oh, and did I mention paid subscriptions and discount cards.

Next steps

If this sounds like your next career move, then click on the ‘Apply’ button now. Please note that we may commence interviewing candidates prior to the application closing date.

Mathematics, Statistics & Information Sciences (Science & Technology)
SEEK's portfolio of diverse businesses make a positive impact on a truly global scale. Our purpose is to help people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and help organisations succeed. We create world-class technology solutions to connect more people to relevant employment, education, small business and volunteer opportunities.

We have a culture of high-performance in our workplaces and celebrate the diversity of our employees who contribute to the success of our organisation.
Life at SEEK
SEEK's purpose is at the centre of everything we do.

Our SEEK , which defines the way we work, is all about what makes us unique and a little bit different.
Passion, Team, Delivery and Future are our principles that drive innovation and creativity.

SEEK strives to support employee wellbeing by providing an amazing experience at work which led us to being named AFR BOSS Top 10 Best Place to Work 2023 In Tech (third year in a row).
We are proud to work in an environment that's inclusive where everyone's unique ideas, experiences and perspectives are valued.

Our award-winning head office in Cremorne (just a 4 min walk from Richmond station) provides an exceptional space to collaborate with colleagues.

The building provides sweeping views of the city, a games area, sit and stand desks at every workstation, modern end-of-trip facilities and Thursday night drinks which gives our people an opportunity to connect in a social setting.
Job Description
About the role

As a Senior Data Scientist you will provide technical and project leadership to an established Machine Learning / Data Science capability driving global SEEK growth.

You will add value by creating data analytics and machine learning assets that influence or automate important business decisions, by bringing new technical and delivery capability to the team, by breaking down big rocks into small rocks in Agile fashion to enable team productivity, and by liaising with Product Managers, Engineers, and partners company-wide to remove impediments.

Your breadth and depth of expertise will enable your highly engaged colleagues to grow, and your experience will help the team understand the best time to use and not use each capability.
You are motivated by science, i.e.

, you:

think of the simplest practical model that closes a knowledge gap; design experiments; learn from the data; provide predictions that matter; and refine your models and hypothesis as needed.
You are continuously learning and growing and so is the team.
You will demonstrate success through enriching SEEK's ability to make great data-driven decisions quickly.

You will consistently demonstrate technical leadership that advances the team's ability to deploy state-of-the-art decision capabilities that produce great outcomes for the health of the jobs marketplace.
The Team

TheArtificial Intelligence Platform Services(AIPS) is structured into cross-disciplinary squad with members from Data Science, Strategy and Engineering who work together to research, design, build and support end-to-end machine learning based products delivering direct value to hirers and job seekers.
AIPS has a matrix structure where your direct line manager will act as a coach and technical mentor, but your day-to-day activity will be determined by the squad priorities

Key accountabilities include:
Forming clear data addressable problem statements from current business problems
Gathering, validating, and understanding data relevant to the problem statement

Strategic Intelligence Analyst and Data Custodian, Forensics and Information Management Branch
• One (1) ongoing role in the Forensics and Information Management Branch, Corporate Services Division
• Salary $105,479 plus 11% superannuation, VPS Grade 5
• Based in Melbourne CBD or Ballarat, with flexibility to work from home

What we offer

The State Revenue Office is the Victorian Government's revenue management agency, administering a range of taxes, duties, levies, grants and subsidies.

We aim to develop our people to achieve great outcomes for the Victorian community. We offer flexible working arrangements and a workplace culture that is rewarding and productive, where contributions are valued and recognised, expectations are clear, and treatment is fair and equitable. We are an equal opportunity employer that is committed to providing an inclusive, accessible and safe working environment.

Find out more about working at the SRO at sro.vic.gov.au/careers, or via our LinkedIn page.

The opportunity

The Strategic Intelligence Analyst and Data Custodian is responsible for undertaking complex research and analysis projects in areas relating to compliance with State Legislation, organisational compliance, strategic and tactical intelligence, and policy development. The position requires a person with a record of achievement in complex data analysis in the public or private sector.

Reporting to the Compliance Analysis and Data Quality Manager, you will be responsible for:
• Undertaking high level analysis and research tasks relating to organisational compliance and revenue issues and prepare associated research papers and reports.
• Consolidating data inputs and the receipt and dissemination of data to internal and external stakeholders.
• Producing daily and monthly branch and divisional reports and monitoring and analysis of revenue collections against forecasts.
• Providing expert analytical advice to senior management on revenue collections and matters under investigation.
• Providing information to Treasury and other internal and external stakeholders relating to revenue collection matters and providing timely and appropriate responses to information/reports sought.

Who we are looking for

To be successful in this role, you will have:
• Demonstrated record of achievement as a senior analyst, preferably in a tax or revenue field, enabling the translation of data insights into actionable business strategies.
• Demonstrated ability to analyse complex datasets, extract meaningful insights, and make data-driven decisions through advanced analytical techniques.
• Profound understanding and application of statistical methodologies and techniques, and the ability to apply them effectively to solve real-world problems using specialised analytical software packages.
• Demonstrated ability to effectively plan, coordinate and manage work activities both in a team and independently with minimal direction.
• Strong verbal and written communication skills to present findings, explain methodologies, and collaborate with cross-functional teams.

How to apply

Submit an application via the ‘Apply now' button by 11.59pm on 24 September 2023. You will need to upload a cover letter addressing Key Selection Criteria 1, 2 and 3 in the position description and a resume.

More information

You can find out more about this role via the position description. You can also contact James Harrison, Compliance Analysis and Reporting Manager, Forensics and Information Management Branch on 03 9628 6863.

If you need a copy of this advertisement in an accessible format, email HRServices@sro.vic.gov.au.

Please note, as part of our selection process, we conduct pre-appointment checks including those related to references, identity, qualifications, work history, work visa, and police record history.

This role may be subject to a probation period.

MECCA Brands is experiencing growing demand for customer data analysis to support the delivery of our long-term digital roadmap. As a result, there is an exciting opportunity for a customer focused and analytically minded Customer Data Analyst to join our team as we build out personalisation, digital engagement and behavioural marketing at scale.

The Role You Could Play

Reporting to the Customer Data Enablement Lead, the Senior Customer Data Analyst needs to deeply understand the power of data to lead the delivery of considered customer data solutions as part of personalisation initiatives and larger strategic programs of work. We are looking for a passionate data nerd well-versed in using data to transform customer interactions in marketing, sales and digital experience and familiar with marketing technology transformation, automation and process change within an organisation.

As a key member of the team, you will be working on a variety of analytical challenges in support of enabling omnichannel customer experience initiatives. You will leverage data from internal and external sources to build and measure segmentations, find groups of customers to grow, reactivate or acquire for the business and close the loop through the enablement of customer journeys and test & learn initiatives.

As a key member of the team, you will contribute to the development of data capabilities and products that enable omnichannel customer experience initiatives. You will collaborate extensively with internal teams to gather requirements and utilise your understanding of MECCA's data to advise on and develop solutions to grow existing customers and reactivate and acquire for the business.

What You Will Bring

You will utilise your expertise in data analysis, to shape the use of customer data at MECCA to deliver value to business and our customers. As we are going through a period of transformation, including continuous improvement of a new tech stack, you will need to be passionate about new technologies and willing to learn and apply new data manipulation and analysis tools. As the team grows, you will be passionate about empowering others with data and driving this through coaching and documentation.

You will also need to have:
• Strong experience in data analysis and reporting, preferably in Retail
• Experience in managing marketing technology platforms to deliver personalisation
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to explain complex information in simple terms
• Strong SQL skills and manipulating datasets
• Ability to deliver ideas from inception to execution, particularly as part of a cross-functional and collaborative team
• Adaptability and proven ability to work in a fast-paced and changing environment

Your Life At MECCA

Whilst we are singularly focused on our #CustomerFirst mantra, we know that wouldn’t be possible without an incredible team that is guided by our MECCA values and motivated each and every day to be solutions focused, innovative, collaborative and adaptable, and have a bit of fun along the way!

• Professional development programs and first-class digitised learning offering

There are also so many other ways in which you’ll be made to feel part of the MECCA story as we love to celebrate, surprise and delight our team along the way.

To learn more about life at MECCA Brands, follow us on LinkedIn at MECCA Brands or @lifeatmecca and for all current opportunities, visit www.mecca.com.au/careers

About the role:

The Tertiary Skills and Pathways team is responsible for the unit mapping project, as part of its program of work. Unit mapping uses natural language processing techniques to create a connection between tertiary education learning materials (VET and HE units), and skills taxonomies. Unit mapping helps to identify skills taught in tertiary education, and their potential relationship to occupations and the labour market, to assist in analysis and advice on tertiary education delivery.

The team is working on a demonstration project basis with five key projects to design the end to end process of unit mapping, to continually refine the data science model, and to generate insights on the potential use of mapping outputs. The outputs of models are large, for example one university with approximately 3,000 units can have an output of approximately 30,000 skills mapped. Validation of outputs is a critical part of the mapping process to produce a model and results that are highly accurate.

Duties:
• Developing of a comprehensive internal and external validation process for very large data sets, to support improvement of data science models, and the quality of output data sent to partners. This may require an ensemble of approaches, for example statistical sampling, manual and automated approaches to validation.
• Managing internal validation processes before outputs are sent to project partners.
• Working closely with the data science team to provide feedback for the mapping model development.
• Analysing complex model outputs, to derive valuable insights for reporting to project partners, including visualisation techniques.
• Providing advice to technical services on interface design for a validation application for project partners.

Required experience/skills:
• Demonstrated experience in data analysis and process design, to create replicable data validation processes to improve data output quality.
• Excellent analytical skills, with strong attention to detail, and the ability to synthesise and critically analyse large volumes of structured and unstructured data.
• Strong skills and experience in data management, in particular how data can be effectively structured, analysed, presented and communicated, to achieve high-quality outcomes.
• Excellent communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate key data insights visually and in written form to a range of diverse stakeholders
• Well-developed interpersonal skills, including the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary setting.

Desirable experience skills:
• Experience in R Shiny, Python, SQL, anduser experience design.
• Understanding of, and experience working with tertiary education (HE and/or VET) and/or occupation and labour market data.
• Understanding and experience in data science, or related fields.
• Experience operating in a policy environment.

The Opportunity

Due to an exciting growth phase, Centric is seeking a Junior Research Analyst to join our Investment Platform. This is a full-time, permanent opportunity, flexible on location for the right person.

The Investment team is a dynamic part of the Centric Group. The team is responsible for multiple investment components that are delivered to dealer groups and other external partners including trustee and administrative. A key area of the teams responsibilities is model portfolios / managed accounts where we provide asset allocation and investment blending targeting specific investment objectives.

The successful candidate will learn how an investment is likely to perform and how sustainable it is. You will participate in our sound portfolio-management strategy by providing the necessary data for our decision-making process.

What does a typical week look like?
• Performance reporting for portfolios, sectors and individual funds,
• Quantitative analysis on respective listed and unlisted investments,
• Adviser and client materials,
• Preparation of recommendations for Investment Committee purposes,
• Investment administration as required (compliance/risk checks etc),
• Liaise with external investment and fund managers.

The natural progression of this role is into an analyst role, where you would be involved in fund manager research, macroeconomic research, and portfolio construction amongst other things.

Let's Talk About You

The successful person will possess the following skills, experience and attributes:
• Relevant Tertiary degree in Finance/Business/Economics/Investments,
• CFA or relevant industry qualification (highly regarded),
• Relevant working experience within financial planning, investments, etc.
• Solid understanding of financial set-up, procedures, statistics and economics
• Excellent quantitative and qualitative analytical skills
• Demonstrated background in working with others to achieve common outcomes and/or goals,
• Stay focused and use time effectively to achieve goals by ensuring outcomes are the primary focus of actions,
• Ability to display original thinking and creativity

The Perks
• Dynamic working environment – work from home and/or office, great flexibility to work around your family, lifestyle or personal commitments
• Work with a collaborative, fun team
• Beautiful office facilities with quality, ergonomic equipment
• Access to Employee Assistance Program and online learning, supporting a healthy work-life balance
• Career development opportunities based on your preferences as the business is rapidly growing

Why Centric?

data.job_title: Lecturer/Senior Lecturer in Mathematics or Statistics
data.job_description:
About the Role
Your work will complement the established research and education strengths of the school which range from the applied to the theoretical. You will also have a strong commitment to teaching and the supervision of research students. Teaching will occur within the School of Mathematics and Statistics undergraduate and postgraduate programs and the applicant will have the opportunity to teach mathematics and its applications to a variety of audiences.

Your responsibilities will include:
• The conduct of research and contribution to knowledge through scholarship, refereed publications and presentations.
• Active application and success in obtaining external research grant income to support that research
• Proactive development of subject materials and delivery, including the use of modern technology and online resources as appropriate
• Development of curriculum in mathematics and/or statistics in both undergraduate and postgraduate levels

Who We Are Looking For
We seek an individual who possesses the potential for research excellence in mathematics or statistics, with the ability to engage in research collaborations, secure research funding, and effectively teach both undergraduate and graduate-level mathematics or statistics courses.

You will also have:
• A PhD or equivalent research higher degree in mathematics, statistics or a closely related discipline
• The ability to interact well with other academic staff and to contribute to the administration of a large school
• Clear potential in graduate student supervision
• Demonstrated ability to develop, administer and see through to completion appropriately designed research projects with limited supervision

For further information regarding responsibilities and requirements, please refer to the attached PD.

This position requires the incumbent to hold a current and valid Working with Children Check to ensure the University provides a safe environment for everyone.

Your New Team – School of Mathematics and Statistics
The University of Melbourne's School of Mathematics and Statistics is one of Australia's leading mathematics and statistics schools. It has achieved this status through the high quality of its research and teaching programs. The School offers a wide range of subjects to undergraduate and postgraduate students and is involved in aspects of community life that impact on the interests of the School and the discipline.

The School of Mathematics and Statistics has a total of 90 continuing teaching and/or research staff; 37 research only staff and consultants; 19 academic specialists and 16 support staff. In 2023, there were 143 Research Higher Degree and 189 Coursework Master of Science students and over 13,000 undergraduate students. Seven members of the School staff and one Emeritus Professor are members of the Academy of Science. The school currently hosts one ARC Centre of Excellence and one ARC Industrial Transformation Training Centre, and has hosted four ARC Laureate Fellows, thirteen ARC Future Fellows and twenty-four DECRA Fellows.

What We Offer You
In addition, we offer the opportunity to be part of a vibrant community and enjoy a range of benefits, including generous leave provisions, salary packaging, health and well-being services and discounts on graduate courses. For more information, check out our benefits page

About the University of Melbourne
We're tightly connected with the community, both at home and abroad. We take pride in our people, who all contribute to our mission to benefit society through the transformative impact of education and research. Discover more via our website and stay connected with our stories and people on LinkedIn.

We are dedicated to ensuring barrier free and inclusive practices to recruit the most talented candidates. If you require any reasonable adjustments with the recruitment process, please contact the email address listed at the bottom of the page.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Applicants
We aspire to be the University of choice for Indigenous Australians, with unprecedented investment to attract, nurture and retain Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander students and staff. Tangible support through a range of programs and initiatives will ensure that you personally succeed and flourish while at the University of Melbourne.

Want to be part of a MedTech startup working on cutting edge technology? Want to contribute to a groundbreaking, live product with real world impact? Let me tell you about Cyban…

About Cyban

Cyban is advancing the way brain injuries are detected and managed through the creation of their patented, non-invasive medical device which monitors brain oxygen and pressure levels. Their Brain Pulse Monitor delivers accurate results quickly to enable confident clinical care at every stage of the patient journey and helps hospitals to save costs and free up valuable resources.

Cyban’s first product for use in patients with Acute Brain Injuries is close to launching after significant clinical trials in patients with some of the world’s most well-known and regarded institutions and a successful round of funding. This is the perfect time to join the team and be part of something meaningful!

About the role

Cyban is looking for a passionate and highly skilled Data Scientist to join their team. Working closely with their team of data scientists, research scientists, and engineers, you will play a pivotal role in developing innovative algorithms to extract valuable insights from complex biological waveforms. Your work will directly impact the development of production ready advanced medical technologies, improving patient care and outcomes.

What will you be doing?

Algorithm and Model Development for Clinical Outcomes
• Leverage your expertise in Machine Learning (ML) and data analysis to design, develop, and optimise statistical models and algorithms for biological waveform data and clinical outcomes.
• Utilise advanced techniques such as deep learning, ensemble models, and time-series analysis to improve data accuracy and interpretability.
• Extract relevant features, identify trends, anomalies, and predictive biomarkers, while regularly evaluating and fine-tuning model performance to enhance algorithmic efficiency.

Data Exploration and Visualisation
• Conduct in-depth exploratory data analysis to identify patterns and relationships within biological waveform datasets.
• Visualise findings in a meaningful and interpretable manner, enabling stakeholders to gain insights and make informed decisions.

Research Advancements
• Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in signal processing and ML algorithms, methodologies, and tools.
• Continuously explore and evaluate emerging technologies and techniques that could enhance the effectiveness and efficiency of data analysis.

Documentation and Reporting
• Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processing steps, model development processes, and experimental results.
• Prepare reports and present findings to internal and external stakeholders, communicating complex concepts in a clear and concise manner.

What skills and qualifications are we looking for?
• Bachelor’s or post-graduate qualifications in a related field e.g Statistics, Data Science, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or Neuroscience.
• You have a minimum 3 years commercial or industry work experience in Data Science or a related field, alongside your academic studies or research.
• Proficient in Python and have experience in other languages e.g R or MATLAB.
• Skilled in statistical analysis and ML frameworks, with a solid understanding of time-series analysis, signal processing techniques, and feature extraction methods.
• Experience or strong interest in health or medical-related technology, with an understanding of relevant physiological and clinical concepts.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, able to dissect and understand complex datasets and extract meaningful insights. Proficient in statistical analysis and hypothesis testing to validate findings and ensure the robustness of models.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively articulate and present technical concepts to diverse teams and medical professionals.

Plus, bonus points for:
• Experience in getting ML models into production
• Familiarity with biological waveforms and experience working with processed physiological time series data from medical devices (e.g., PPG, ECG, or EEG sensors)
• Familiarity with languages like C++ and C, cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)

This is a hybrid role within a dynamic start-up environment, where priorities and requirements may evolve rapidly. At Cyban, they believe that success comes through recognising the value of their people and fostering an environment of respect and openness. They work with a sense of urgency and purpose and continuously endeavour to understand the perspectives and needs of those who will use their products.

Sounds exciting? Want to know more?

Apply now or reach out to Cass at affix: cass.galliott@affix.com.au

data.job_title: EOI - Data Engineer - Data and Analytics
data.job_description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

What if your most rewarding experiences couldn’t be captured by a resume?

At EY we believe that whoever you are, your uniqueness helps us stand apart.

We bring together extraordinary people, like you, to build a better working world. This role is open to applicants across Adelaide, Melbourne, Perth, Brisbane, Canberra and Sydney.

EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific, with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.
• As this is an expressions of interest advertisement, please allow some delay in us getting back to your application*

What’s in it for you?

As a Data Engineer, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives. Some of your responsibilities will include:
• Be able to clearly explain data and analytics strengths and weaknesses to both technical and senior business stakeholders
• Responsible for developing batch ingestion and data transformation routines using ETL tools or other ingestion techniques
• Responsible for developing real-time ingestion and data transformation routines using Kafka and similar technologies
• Responsible for migrating data from legacy data platform to cloud data platform
• Present data in graphs, charts, tables, etc. and designing and developing relational databases for collecting data.

What We’re Looking For

Here’s our ‘wish list’ but don’t worry if you don’t tick all the boxes. We’re interested in your strengths, what you want to learn, and how far you want to go.
• Configuration and coordination of data pipelines across projects
• Data pipeline development, including Azure Data Factory, AWS Kinesis and/or Spark
• Migration and transformation of large complex data sets from legacy systems like Teradata to cloud platform using Azure tools and other ETL tools like DataStage
• Data and Reporting Platform development on environments using technologies such as Microsoft Azure, SAP BW, Teradata, PowerBI or Cognos
• A strong background in coding with possible experience with Python, SAS, SQL and/or R
• Project delivery toolset experience in one or more batch ETL tools (such as DataStage, Informatica, Microsoft SSIS, Azure Data Factory or Talend) and/or open-source data integration tools (such as Kafka or Nifi)

What We Can Offer You
• Explore how a career at EY is yours to build at www.ey.com/au/careerdevelopment
• Discover how, when and where you can work at www.ey.com/au/flexibility
• Learn about our commitment to DE&I at www.ey.com/au/diversity-inclusiveness
• Understand how our benefits can support you at www.ey.com/au/benefits

Acknowledgement of Country

EY acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which EY offices are located around Australia. We pay our respects to their cultures, and to their Elders — past, present, and emerging. Find out more about our vision for reconciliation at www.ey.com/au/reconciliation

Apply now… we’re over 9,000 perspectives in Australia and we’re ready to welcome yours.

At EY we take inclusivity seriously, and we’re committed to removing barriers and improving the employment prospects of people with disability or long-term health conditions. We encourage you to share any support and adjustments you need to be your best and participate equitably in our recruitment process. We understand sharing your needs with us can be daunting, so if you have questions before or during your application, we welcome you to get in touch at contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or +61 3 8650 7788 (option 2). Anything you tell us will be kept completely confidential.

The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.

Our preferred applicant will be required to undertake employment screening by EY or our external third-party provider.

The minimum salary for this role is AUD $90,000 inclusive of 11% superannuation and dependent on skills and experience.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

We provide highly skilled expertise in Data & Analytics, Cloud Strategy, Application Modernisation, and Cybersecurity.

The key technical skills we’re looking for in this role are:
