About the role

Job Title: Data Analyst - ANZ Plus

Location: Melbourne preferred

Blended Working Model
• Work in an agile way to innovate and deliver quality outcomes at pace
• Be a part of our Australian Business Transformation, and work with people who are passionate about redefining banking for the future
• Join a progressive organisation with the people and policies you want

At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive and to achieve this, we need a talented Data Analyst to join our Data Enablement chapter within our Australian Business Transformation. Your mission is to derive compelling insights and identify opportunities to shape the direction of our customer experience. You will be working within a cross functional team and driving end to end delivery of insights.

Your key accountabilities will include:
• Work with agile teams on identifying analytical opportunities
• Curating and modelling data to ascertain customer and business value
• Visualising outcome and presenting compelling opportunities to stakeholders

What will your day look like
• Embedding within Agile teams you will be individually accountable to ensure that quantitative analysis is performed across a number of customer and business driven use cases
• You will be working with key product owners to formulate details hypotheses to work on which will fundamentally change the direction of the squad
• Working with data will be a key part of the role including the need to discover, identify, curate and model the data appropriately to drive insights
• All insights will need to be presented back to key stakeholder and will require the development of interactive reports and dashboards

What will you bring?

We know not everyone will bring all of the skills and experience, and at ANZ we are focused on people bringing a growth mindset to their approach to work. Some of the skills we are looking for are below, but don’t worry if you don’t have all of these as learning on the job is the way we work.

But back to some of the skills –
• Strong BI expertise, Visualization, Tableau highly advantageous
• Data Discovery against business objectives
• Definition of Metrics and Translation to data Model
• Data Modelling, able to design data model /concept and understand the solution architecture in Cloud infrastructure
• Requirements Gathering / Gap Analysis: Business consulting interaction, Documentation
• Data manipulation: translation, prototyping, problem solving
• Technical data expertise: strong SQL – Big Query/Cloud highly advantageous

You’re not expected to have 100% of these skills. At ANZ a growth mindset is at the heart of our culture, so if you have most of these things in your toolbox, we’d love to hear from you.

So, why join us?

There’s something special about being part of ANZ. From the moment you join us, you’re part of a team working towards a common goal: improving the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our millions of customers.

But it’s not just our customers who’ll feel your impact. You’ll feel it too. Because at ANZ, you’ll have the resources and community you need to take the next big step in your career, towards even bigger things in the future.

We offer a range of benefits tailored to the countries in which we operate including Health and Wellbeing programs and flexible working arrangements.

You’ll also enjoy working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated. We encourage you to talk to us about any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.

Job Description

Sr Data Analyst, Managed Services - 1 year fixed-term

Melbourne (Australia)

About the role:

Do you want to be a part of Visa’s fastest growing team in Australia and New Zealand? Do you enjoy delivering and getting things done? Do you want to make positive impacts for customers and accelerate the pace of innovation in the payments industry? If so, Visa Managed Services (VMS) is the team for you.

The VMS team is all about delivery, implementation, and execution. We create squads of delivery consultants to embed within our clients’ organizations to help them deliver better results, faster.’

If you're a Data Analyst who loves data, create insights, solve challenging business problems and want to use your skills for the greater good… then we have the perfect role for you!

Why join us:
• This role will support a key strategic client in Australia helping them deliver on their bank-wide, large-scale simplification agenda.
• Visa Managed Services is our fastest growing team in Australia and New Zealand – we’ve grown 10x in less than 2 years – and always have fun projects on the horizon to sink our teeth into
• We get to work with incredible people every day. We’re a team of intrapreneurs who work hard, have fun, and get stuff done.
• We are a people business where the people are our product. As a result, all our people leaders are 100% dedicated to ensuring a positive employee experience. We attract top talent and are manically focused on developing and retaining that talent at Visa.
• We are committed to building a diverse team with an inclusive culture that reflects the communities we work in
• We’re a global company and VMS is a global focus area for Visa. Once established in our Australia team, you’ll have the opportunity to explore roles focused on scaling our VMS business around the world.
• We support flexible working options and industry leading compensation & benefits.

Join us and make a difference today.

What you will be doing:

Ideally based in Melbourne but with hybrid work options, you will develop and maintain dashboards to understand the performance of various portfolio optimisation initiatives. Your responsibilities will include transforming data for use in creation, maintenance, and automation of the dashboards. You will work closely with the Data Delivery Lead, Product Consultant and Client Portfolio lead to build dashboards, generate insights, solve business problems using customer and transactional data.

In this role you will:
• Explore our clients’ data infrastructure and systems, analyse various datasets, perform data analysis, finding patterns and generating valuable insights to support critical business initiatives and present them back to the business teams.
• Build dashboards to visualize insights and understand behaviour of customers or understand performance of various portfolio optimisation initiatives.
• Perform ad-hoc analysis to solve business problems and support decisions.
• Producing written communication, visualizations and presentations for leadership and other key stakeholders.

What you will bring:

Key competencies:
• Solution-mindset – Applying creative problem-solving techniques and championing a client-first approach to customer insights when opportunities and challenges arise to meet specific business objectives.
• Active Contributor to Team Success – Strong team orientation with a collaborative, diplomatic, and flexible style. Able to work effectively in a matrixed organization.
• Tenacity – Self-motivated, results-oriented individual with the ability to progress multiple priorities concurrently.
• Building Strategic Work Relationships - Excellent client engagement and relationship management skills with a collaborative approach to stakeholder management
• Driving Execution – Motivated by delivery and with a high attention to detail.

What you will need to be successful:
• Proficient in SQL as an intermediate to advanced level.
• Experience of working on data platforms like Teradata or GCP is highly preferred.
• Experience in data visualisation is required, Tableau or QlikSense is highly preferred.
• Experience in analytics programming languages (e.g., Python) is highly preferred.
• Advanced skills in Excel and PowerPoint and the ability to effectively communicate a story through data (visualisations, storytelling)
• Experience with GitHub and Confluence is highly preferred.
• Adept at data crunching, and passionate about unearthing significant patterns and meaningful insights.
• An eye for accuracy, the ability to self-manage multiple data sets and data requests, and flexibility to respond quickly.

You’re not expected to have 100% of these skills. At Visa a growth mindset is at the heart of our culture, so if you have most of these things in your toolbox, we’d love to hear from you.

What will also help:
• High performance delivery focus with a high attention to detail
• Strong communication skills to make complex concepts accessible for business stakeholders.
• Ability to influence and collaborate at all levels without relying on hierarchy.
• Strong team orientation with a collaborative, diplomatic, flexible style and able to work effectively across multiple teams.
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
• Outcome orientated, persistence to challenge the status quo and deliver customer results.
• A Growth mindset, constantly striving to learn and develop.
• Excellent client engagement and relationship management skills with a collaborative approach to stakeholder management
• Innovation minded with high problem-solving skills, with demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor.
• Self-motivated, results-oriented individual with the ability to progress multiple priorities concurrently.

Why Work with us:
• We are known for offering industry-leading compensation.
• We have state of the art offices in Melbourne, Sydney, and Auckland
• We provide world class benefits including:
• Mental health and wellbeing resources to all employees
• Generous annual leave plus carers leave, parental leave, baby bonding leave, and pregnancy loss leave, among others
• Paid volunteering leave & employee referral program cash awards.
• Ability to work from another location for up to 1 month each year.
• Global company with global opportunities. We can share endless stories of how we’ve supported our employees to accelerate their career progression and pursue opportunities in other geographies around the world.

This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.

Qualifications

• Proficient in SQL as an intermediate to advanced level.

• Experience of working on data platforms like Teradata or GCP is highly preferred.

• Experience in data visualisation is required, Tableau or QlikSense is highly preferred.

• Experience in analytics programming languages (e.g., Python) is highly preferred.

• Advanced skills in Excel and PowerPoint and the ability to effectively communicate a story through data (visualisations, storytelling)

• Experience with GitHub and Confluence is highly preferred.

• Adept at data crunching, and passionate about unearthing significant patterns and meaningful insights.

• An eye for accuracy, the ability to self-manage multiple data sets and data requests, and flexibility to respond quickly.

Additional Information

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

The role

data.job_description: Infosys Consulting is the worldwide management and IT consultancy unit of the Infosys Group (NYSE: INFY), a global advisor to leading companies for strategy, process engineering, and technology-enabled transformation programs.We partner with clients to design and implement customized solutions to address their complex business challenges, and to help them in a post-modern ERP world. By combining innovative and human-centric approaches with the latest technological advances, we enable organizations to reimagine their future and create sustainable and lasting business value.A pioneer in breaking down the barriers between strategy and execution, Infosys Consulting delivers superior business value to its clients by advising them on strategy, process optimisation, and IT-enabled transformation. To find out how we go beyond the expected to deliver the exceptional, visit us at www.infosysconsultinginsights.com Infosys Consulting – is a real consultancy for real consultants.RequirementsWe have an opportunity available for a Data Analyst - Energy Solutions - Consultant / Senior Consultant to join our Team.Role: Data Analyst - Energy SolutionsLocation: MelbournePermanent or Fixed Term contract – 12 months with Possible extensionsRequirements: • Understanding and supporting the data needs of the business designer and product owner. • Data analysis and exploration : Perform upfront discovery of the data hub and determine if the data is accurate and reliable for the use case. Consider how to get the data into Datahub if it is not already there. • Define the data requirements for the delivery team. • Collaboration with the data engineers and reporting teams for the delivery of prototypes and proofs of concept. • Identify and lead the resolution of data-related issues.Must have skills:Knowledge of relational databases, AWS services, data modelling, data integration, understanding of data warehousing concepts, Oil and gas industry knowledge, proficiency in Excel, ETL processes, data governance, data security etcDesirable : Energy trading & shipping (T&S)BenefitsWe welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion, or belief. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience, skills, and personality. We believe that employing a diverse workforce is the right thing to do and is central to our success.We offer you great opportunities within a dynamically growing consultancy. You will elaborate and deliver best practice solutions and will be able to further develop your solution design, implementation, and project management skills. At Infosys Consulting you will discover a truly global culture, highly dedicated and motivated colleagues, a cooperative work environment and interesting training opportunities.

Join a collaborative team and deliver great employee experiences.

Experience Hybrid working arrangements in a flexible environment

Permanent role based in either Melbourne or Sydney

We're REA

REA Group is not your average digital business. From humble beginnings in a garage in Melbourne’s east in 1995, we have grown into a leading global digital business, specialising in property.

With bold and ambitious goals, we are changing the way the world experiences property. No matter where you're at on your property journey, we're here to help with every step - whether that's finding or financing your next home.

Our people are the key to our success. At the heart of everything we do, is a thriving culture centred around high performance and care. We are purpose driven and collaborative, which drives innovation and our ability to make a real impact. As such, we’re proud to be named in Australia’s “Top 5” Best Workplaces two years in a row, as well as being recognised as a Best Workplace for Women.

Where the team fits in

The Data and Insights Analyst sits within the People & Culture team, headed up by Mary Lemonis,

Chief People and Sustainability Officer. From building management capability and the next

generation of leaders, to creating a diversity and inclusion strategy which is mainstreamed and

embedded into everything we do – the People & Culture team is all about making REA Group a great place to work. Supporting our multi-national business with HR processes, policies and systems to meet the needs of our people around the world, the team works to build high engagement with our impressive offering of programs and benefits.

What the role is all about

We are looking for a technically focussed Data and Insights Analyst who is passionate about People data and insights. You’ll be supporting the People & Culture team with key employee life cycle activities related to our specialist functions of Remuneration, Payroll and Work Health and Safety. You’ll contribute your subject matter expertise and work with a wide a range of activities and stakeholders.

Working closely with our Remuneration Manager, managing job evaluations, equity administration and cyclical rem processes like year end reviews and market data submissions, ensuring an efficient process, up to date information and fit for purpose solutions

Reviewing and supporting current WHS processes and policies, and determining what potential efficiencies can be made using technology and effective collaboration with key stakeholders

Assisting with payroll reporting, in particular making the best use of our new payroll reporting functionality in the Ramco payroll system.

Using modelling, statistics, trend analysis, and other data analysis techniques to collect, explore, identify, and analyse data.

Who we’re looking for

Intermediate to advanced Excel skills

Super strong attention to detail

Strong background and demonstrated experience in reporting and analytics, data science, continuous improvement

General problem-solving skills and ability to think creatively

Work productively in a fast-paced environment

Relevant qualification associated with data and analytics will be preferable

Data Analytics - using modeling, statistics, trend analysis, and other data analysis techniques to collect, explore, identify, and analyze data.

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal and the sensitivity to understand audience needs and adapt style accordingly

Translating business requirements into clear, concise, testable and accurate user stories & process flows;

Time management and prioritisation

Experience working with HR/ People analytics

Experience with Workday & Ramco is advantageous but not essential

Broad knowledge and understanding of people management principles and practices

Ability to work independently and cooperatively with business and technical resources

The REA experience

The physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our people is something we’ll never stop caring about. This is a place to learn and grow. We’re committed to your development – both professionally and personally. Your experience with us is something we take seriously.

We offer:

A hybrid and flexible approach to working - https://rea.to/hybrid-working

Flexible parental leave offering for primary and secondary carers

Programs to support mental, emotional, financial and physical health & wellbeing

Our Because We Care program offers employees volunteering leave, community grants, matched payroll giving and our Community Café donates 100% of revenue to charity.

Hack Days so you can bring your big ideas to life

Performance recognition programs because hard work should never go unnoticed

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We believe teams with diverse ideas and experiences are more creative, more eﬀective and fuel disruptive thinking - be it cultural and ethnic backgrounds, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, or any other identity or lived experience. We know diverse teams are critical to maintaining our success and driving new business opportunities. If you've got the skills, dedication and enthusiasm to learn but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch.

If you like the sound of us, then we think you should apply today. We're proud to be Circle Back Initiative Employer and we commit to respond to every applicant. While we're looking at your application, and preparing to come back to you with an update, why not get to know us a bit more through our various social channels?

data.job_description:
About the Role

An exciting opportunity to join BOQ as a Senior Data Management Analyst during our transformation journey. By joining the digital bank of the future, you will be able to make a difference with integrity and empathy, overseeing the successful and effective analysis of the data quality capability adding significant value to our organisation.

As a Senior Data Management Analyst, you will be working closely with the Group Technology Team that consists of Business Analysts, Developers and Testers. Reporting to the Manager of Data Management, you will be responsible for supporting the execution of data initiatives that enable our bankers to have access to trusted, governed and easily available data which supports their needs.

In this role you will ensure data management practices are conducted in line with statutory, regulatory, audit and risk expectations. Furthermore, you will support operations of the Data Management Framework which includes data principles, policy, standards, and guidelines ensuring their pragmatic and beneficial application to data platforms and the wider data ecosystem. You will also be involved in conducting awareness and training initiatives to create a measurable uplift in data literacy and data handling skills across the bank.

About you

As an experienced data management and analytics professional, you will be a collaborative outcome and people focussed individual who thrives on working in a fast-paced environment. You will have 6+ years of experience working in enterprise data platforms (Data Warehousing, Data Analytics Data Governance or BI) with an ability to manipulate and analyse large amounts of data using SQL queries and map data from source to target.

Alongside your experience working with third party vendors and developing lasting relationships to ensure success, you will have a strong understanding and practical experience in data quality, data management/governance frameworks and methodologies.

About Us

BOQ is one of Australia’s leading regional banks and provides a genuine alternative for Australian financial services customers and employees. Our purpose is to create prosperity for our customers, shareholders and people through empathy, integrity and by making a difference. Our ambition is to be known as the bold challenger bank; with multi-brands that are digitally enabled with a personal touch.

BOQ is passionate about providing opportunities for you to develop your career as we continuously adapt and deliver in a transformational and collaborative environment with a strong focus on community.

BOQ’s Inclusion vision is to foster a workspace that values and leverages difference and creates new possibilities, a place where our people feel confident to bring their best selves to work every day. We embrace difference and believe that our workforce should reflect the customers and communities that we serve.

Since BOQ Group is recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA).

Our Benefits
Flexible working arrangements Discounted financial products Salary sacrificing options Paid parental leave with no minimum Paid volunteer days Purchase annual leave Discounted private health insurance plan Employee Assistance Program (EAP) 5 employee diversity network groups focusing on: First Nations Reconciliation Council, Proudly ME (LGBTIQA+), Multicultural, Gender and Early Career BOQ Group is a member of Pride in Diversity and a participating organisation in the Australian Workplace Equality Index

**If you love:**
- Identifying, communicating and working cross-functionally, to resolve data gaps impacting the team’s reporting and analytical requirements
- Working collaboratively to automate manual data processes to drive operational efficiency wherever possible
- Support the development of Risk’s new data platform in the MS Azure environment
- Responsible for data requests from both internal and external stakeholders
- Assist with ongoing data quality improvement initiatives across the risk landscape
- Work to upskill and mentor junior Analysts within the team and wider business
• *Then this just might be…**
• *Your dream job:**
- Accountable for end-to-end data analytics solutions, including documentation and quality assurance
- Support data governance through the documentation of data sources and data lineage
- Adopting best practice, take responsibility for the migration of existing reporting and the build out of new reporting in Power BI on the new data platform
- Support the testing of front-line system changes that impact data integration across the risk data platform

Description

We are currently seeking a motivated and experienced Data Analyst on a permanent, full-time basis to review data to identify key insights, and solve problems and be able to communicate this information to various stakeholders across the organisation.

The Data Analyst will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. The Data Analyst will be responsible for conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. The Data Analyst will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.

Key duties of the role include:
• Interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
• Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and quality.
• Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
• Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
• Filter and "clean" data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
• Work with management to prioritise business and information needs.
• Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.

Requirements

What you can bring to the role:

Essential:
• Tertiary level qualification/s in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics.
• At least three years of experience in a Data Analyst role.
• Proven analytical skills, including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization.
• Strong SQL, SSRS and Power BI skills with the ability to learn other analytic tools.
• Current National Police Certificate (or ability to acquire).
• Applicant must be based in Australia.

Desirable:
• Prior experience with database and model design and segmentation techniques.
• Strong programming experience with frameworks including XML, Javascript, and ETL.
• Practical experience in statistical analysis through the use of statistical packages including Excel, SPSS, and SAS.
• Proven success in a collaborative, team-oriented environment.

Benefits

What We Offer: In return for your dedication and expertise, we offer:
• * Competitive remuneration and benefits
• Attractive pay incentives, along with not-for-profit salary packaging.
• The chance to engage in purposeful work within a values-driven organisation.
• Long-term job security in an industry resistant to economic fluctuations.
• A thriving, positive organisational culture that prioritizes well-being.
• Abundant prospects for personal and professional growth through learning and development initiatives.
• Discounted health insurance.

Job Description

Location: Melbourne | CBD

Job type: Full time / 6 months

Organisation: Victorian Building Authority

Salary: $105,479 - $127,621

Occupation: IT and Telecommunications

Reference: VG/6274T

The VBA has an exciting 6 month fixed term opportunity to join the State Building Surveyor department in the role of Data Analyst
Position overview
Reporting to the Manager Technical Capability and Capability the primary responsibility of the Data Analyst is to continue to build, expand and maintain the existing data analytics platform.
The Data Analyst will work with structured and unstructured data and has experience working with and integrating data from a variety of sources, including Google Analytics, Survey Monkey, YouTube, Channel Management System (CXOne) and other internal systems, to generate accurate and insightful data analysis and visualisation reports using PowerBI, advanced Excel or Power Apps.
Working with internal data owners to primarily source data, develop and maintain reports that inform the development of education resources and measure the effectiveness of those education resources. In addition, the Data Analyst will provide insights into Channel Management System data to develop and implement efficiencies in the Building and Plumbing Technical and Regulatory Team and perform other data analysis functions to inform the implementation of new regulatory tools.
Who we are looking for

experience in delivering insightful analysis & Power BI reporting solutions on the Azure platform
proven excellence in analytical thinking and the translation of complex unstructured and structured data into informative visuals, reports and actionable insights.
demonstrated ability to be pro-active, professional, customer-focused, organised, and self-managed to deliver a consistently high level of output and service in a deadline and fast-paced environment.

VBA Commitment
We value diversity and inclusion in all forms - gender, religion, ethnicity, LGBTIQ+, disability and neurodiversity. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates are strongly encouraged to apply. We're hoping to find a broad range of experiences, and people from all backgrounds and communities to join us at the VBA.
We invite you to talk to us about any preferences or adjustments you may need to either our recruitment process or the role itself. If you identify as a person with disability, please let us know how we can provide additional support to your application. If this is you, please don't hesitate to get in touch via recruit@vba.vic.gov.au.
We value and encourage flexibility for all, and so we support all our roles to be worked flexibly in some way, including part-time, to support a diverse, adaptive, and high-performing workforce. We encourage you to discuss flexible work options with the hiring manager during the recruitment process.
Working at the VBA - what you can expect

A hybrid working model
Challenging work and a continuous learning environment
Flexible work options including part-time, compressed work schedules, flexible start and finish times, and purchased leave options.
A competitive salary, 11% superannuation

How to Apply
We require you to upload:

A detailed copy of your resume
A cover letter outlining your relevant experience and how you feel it aligns to the role.

Applications Close: Midnight 18th October 2023

Important information

Only electronic applications submitted via careers.vic.gov.au will be accepted.
Candidates deemed suitable from a selection process may be considered for identical or similar vacancies within 6 months.

Our technology, our people, our product... At PointsBet, we’re built different.

Launching in Australia in 2017, PointsBet are dedicated to providing our customers with the ultimate betting experience. We're on a mission to make racing and sports betting easier to understand, fun to use and faster. After some recent business changes, PointsBet Australia is about to head into a exciting stage of it's journey and as we continue to grow, we're looking for an experienced BI Reporting Analyst to join us.

The BI Developer will be responsible for delivering insight and actionable reports across the organisation and focus on becoming a subject matter expert in the company’s data. This role will need to provide support to the Data Analytics team in defining and prioritising requirements as well as testing data before releasing reports to the business. The Senior BI Developer will also be involved in reporting and providing analytical support to the Operations, Trading, Marketing, Compliance, Finance and Product team.

What you’ll own:

• Develop engaging and focused analytical reports & visualizations
• Extract, interpret, and present data and insights using MS SQL and Power BI
• Follow processes and methodologies around implementing and supporting BI systems
• Assist stakeholders to define, clarify, and document reporting and analytical requirements
• Strong stakeholder interaction skills and the ability to communicate insights in a manner that aids and informs decision making
• Establish effective working relationships with internal stakeholders, same department teams, senior management, and external parties
• Ensure the accuracy of reported information and work with data stewards in a cycle of continuous improvement of data quality
• Establish automation and QA processes necessary to ensure quality provided to the business
• Build and maintain a strong documentation repository
• Become an expert in digital wagering data and information
• Assist users to define, clarity, and document reporting and analytical requirements

The skills we seek:

• 3-5+ years of experience in querying data using T-SQL or similar
• Experience with reporting & visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, SSRS
• Experience with data modelling and data warehouse processes
• History in data analysis and presenting insights visually
• Experience in using JIRA and Confluence would be beneficial
• Proficiency in data visualization techniques and dashboard creation in Power BI
• Ability to construct complex queries and manage large data sets.
• The ability to think creatively and problem solve is critical
• Strong attention to detail
• Strong commercial acumen
• Wagering Experience highly regarded

The PB Perks!

• PointsBet Flex Program – Filled with Hybrid Working, Work from Anywhere weeks, Sabbatical Leave to name a few.
• PointsBet Day – Get your PointsBet anniversary off.
• Annual Bonus Scheme – We reward great work, earn even more on top of our competitive salary packages.
• Parental Leave – 18 weeks for Primary Carers and 4 weeks for Secondary Carers.
• Daily breakfasts, sporting event tickets, a range of wellness programs.

So you don’t tick every requirement on the job description but are still interested? Please apply anyway! We are built different at PointsBet, because we think different. We promote diversity of thought and would love to hear from a wide range of applicants as we believe that any unique skillset adds value to the team. Once you're in the door, your talents will be fostered, with 42 Australian promotions in 2022 alone, we are truly committed to growing talent at PointsBet!

Company Description

illion is the leading independent provider of trusted data and analytics products and services in Australia and New Zealand. illion is headquartered in Melbourne with offices in all major metropolitan cities across Australia and New Zealand. Our team work with leading brands in our region to bring data & analytics to life!

Job Description

Your new role and how you’ll make a difference

Our Data and Insights Analysts are charged with the fulfilment of Data Services requests within our Service Level Agreement, as well as maintaining systems and information that provide our customers with the most optimum data specific to their needs!

The value-add things you’ll be doing
• Fulfilment of S&MS Marketing and data lists within Service Level Agreement or as negotiated depending on the complexity of the work requested.
• Scope customer requirements and work with and provide advice to the internal RMS and S&MS sales function to ensure best possible customer solution.
• Maintaining and servicing of existing databases to perpetuate quality output.
• Identify data integrity issues and proactively identify solutions to improve processes and data accuracy.
• Create, maintain and perform analytics and statistical reports required to assist all internal teams including Marketing, Trade, RMS and S&MS using R and/or Python.
• Act as pivot point between IT and trade team to achieve all KPIs set by the business.

Qualifications

The experience and qualifications you’ll need to be successful

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

The Supply Equity Platform (SEP) team sits within the Product Supply team at Agoda Bangkok. We work closely with the sales department (Partner Services) to identify and optimize growth opportunities on accommodations supply for the company and to set up experiments to measure and implement changes. The projects SEP team works on directly impact Agoda’s bottom line and have long lasting structural impact to the business. We cover a range of topics including resource and product optimization. We collaborate with multiple departments and produce high quality results backed up by experimentation and data. Utilizing powerful tools and possessing an end-to-end view of how Agoda works, the SEP offers a team of learning and experience that will push you (and Agoda) into new territory.

In this Role, you’ll get to:

• Identify, support, and lead projects aimed at improving the operations of our automated systems (e.g. root cause detection, anomaly detection, performance analysis).
• Develop automated infrastructure supporting business intelligence at a global level as well as the analytics processes supporting them.
• Drive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving resource and product optimization.

What you’ll Need to Succeed:
• A hacker’s mindset – the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototyping.
• Either Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline with extensive programming experience.

• The ability to visualize and understand complex data flows, pipelines, and processes.

It’s Great if you have:
• Experience with complex analytics and statistical/machine learning techniques using R/Python/Spark.
• Experience building automated analytical processes and functionality.

Data analytics in the energy and climate space is growing at an incredible rate. Blunomy is growing the team to support the energy industry through its digitisation, decentralisation and decarbonisation transition and to support operability and planning in Australia and around the world.

We are looking for someone passionate about energy and data analytics to do-well-and-do-good by delivering data science products to better the energy market. As an analyst, you will work on projects under the supervision of project managers. In this setting, you will be exposed to the diversity of current energy challenges, leveraging your data and analytical skills to address them.

Example projects

We are always growing the products we deliver but over the last 12 months we have delivered:
• Load forecasting: model and predict the evolution of the load on the electrical network. Use machine learning, data analytics and a fair amount of software development to forecast long-term energy consumption, daily energy profiles and Distributed Energy Resources (Electric Vehicles, Battery, Solar PV).
• PV connections approval tool: dynamically model the energy network bringing together power flow modelling and machine learning to determine the PV hosting capacity of the local area. Used in production to approve hundreds of PV connection requests a day.
• Vegetation management using LiDAR: collect three‑dimensional images of the local network gathered by drone or helicopter. Use machine learning and geometric models to detect and manage vegetation near powerlines.
• Bushfire risk modelling: model and compute the network‑related bushfire risk based on fault ignition likelihood. Calculate the consequences of bushfires such as property damage or agricultural loss.
• Low-Voltage network mapping: identify errors within the current mapping of the low-voltage network, especially targeting customers whom connection to the network has not been properly recorded. This was performed using outlier detection with out-of-bag predictors.

Depending on the objectives, projects will entail tasks of varying nature. Your first focus will be on projects requiring data analytics capabilities.

Why work for Blunomy?

You will be joining a passionate group of professionals, aligned in our mission to move towards a decarbonised, circular and inclusive economy. As we are currently in a stage of significant growth, you will be much more than a ‘cog in the machine’, with the ability to make a real and lasting impact across the business. We are focused on finding the right people to journey with us, and to those who do, we offer:
• Attractive salary packages
• Ability to participate in the company bonus scheme
• Hybrid working environment, based in either Melbourne or Sydney
• Ability to be part of a global team
• Ongoing learning and development opportunities
• Weekly team lunch/breakfast
• Access to our health and wellbeing platform, Moka Care

Profil recherché

About you

We are looking for a motivated and talented person. The right person will have some of the following and a willingness and ability to learn the rest:
• You are passionate about the energy transition and climate change, with a strong interest for energy, environment and/or sustainable development
• An undergraduate degree or a postgraduate in a relevant discipline such Computing Science, Statistics, Maths or Engineering
• 1-3 years experience in data science or software development will be highly regarded.
• Knowledge of statistical and machine learning concepts and algorithms
• Experience with the data science tool kit:
• Python or R
• Source control (such as Git)

About Cbus

Created by workers, for workers, Cbus Super is one of Australia’s most successful Superannuation funds. For almost four decades we’ve proudly represented those who help shape Australia, hard-working individuals who deserve to make the most of their retirement, no matter the industry. As an award-winning fund we’ve been recognised for the benefits provided to our members and our innovative investment approach. All while staying committed to our member first ethos as a proud Industry Fund.

About the role

The (Senior) Data Governance Analyst role sits within the Data Governance team and is responsible for collaborating with a range of internal & external stakeholders to understand their information needs and ensure Cbus’ data assets meet and/or exceed those needs within an acceptable level of cost and risk.

The Data Governance team has developed a framework to ensure Cbus’ data assets are well managed in accordance with policies, practices & techniques and meet the availability, quality, & security needs of all stakeholders. The (Senior) Data Governance Analyst plays a key role in helping the team bring the framework to life, embed it into the organisation’s change management & business-as-usual processes, and drive a strong data-centric culture.

In your role you will work with internal & external (business & technical) stakeholders to identify critical data, profile data, investigate data quality anomalies and issues and provide input into improving data quality.

You will also be responsible to work with the data governance team & projects to define, implement, & maintain metadata and reference data, and support users of the data catalog.

To be successful you will have approximately 5 years working in a similar role, with a strong knowledge and understanding of data management. You will have demonstrated experience working with data governance tools & technologies such as Alation, Bigeye, etc and possess strong SQL skills. Knowledge of / demonstrated experience using modern data management solutions such as Amazon S3, Amazon Redshift, DataGrip, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, will also help you succeed.

As a person you will be very analytical, love solving problems and enjoy working collaboratively and being part of a team.

Belong at Cbus

We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. We believe that, with diversity of perspectives and experiences, you get better teams and outcomes. We’re looking for people of all genders, races, nationalities, orientations and of all abilities to join us.

About CPBJH JV

CPBJH JV brings together two of Australia's leading construction partners, CPB Contractors and John Holland, with unparalleled expertise in large-scale and complex project management, civil construction, traffic management and tunnelling.

The West Gate Tunnel is a partnership between the Victorian Government and Transurban. The Joint Venture has been chosen as the contractor for construction, which began in early 2018 following planning assessment.

About the Project

The West Gate Tunnel Project is a city-shaping project that will deliver a vital alternative to the West Gate Bridge, provide quicker and safer journeys, and remove thousands of trucks off residential streets. The project will include:
• Widening the West Gate Freeway from eight lanes to 12 between the M80 Ring Road and Williamstown Road;
• Building a 2.8km eastbound tunnel and a 4km westbound tunnel under Yarraville;
• Constructing a bridge over the Maribyrnong River providing an alternative to the West Gate Bridge;
• Constructing an elevated road along Footscray Road to the Port of Melbourne;
• Major new cycling and pedestrian paths.

Gender Diversity

We aim to maximise the potential of all our people. This means having an inclusive culture that values and sustains diversity and a work-life balance. To achieve this, we are focused on:
• Embedding flexible work practices
• Providing development opportunities for our women
• Leaders championing and supporting our females to succeed
• Actively looking to attract and promote women into non- traditional roles and putting support structures in place to help them succeed.

Your Opportunity

We are currently seeking applications for an experienced Safety Strategy, Systems and Innovation Coordinator to support the Health and Safety team.

Your key responsibilities will include:
• Develop, improve and maintain Power Bi data management software
• Develop new dashboards using advanced Power Bi system knowledge
• By using existing database systems and Power Bi, define new ways to extract and present project data
• Assist with the analysis of safety, health and project data.
• Help shape and lead strategic initiatives to improve safety by analysing trends and identifying risks to project delivery.
• Assist in developing, implementing, and managing an innovative safety system to enhance workplace health and safety.
• Conduct in-depth quarterly analyses of project data to identify trends and focus areas, providing comprehensive reports and recommendations to senior management.
• Schedule, monitor, and report on project safety activities and other Health, Safety, and Environment (HSE) deliverables.
• Collaborate with project clients and business units to share health and safety initiatives and insights.
• Coordinate and facilitate the One HSE Culture Survey Program, analyzing trends to develop and implement cultural initiatives.
• Maintain a safety dashboard to monitor project performance.
• Coordinate and ensure the completion of external assurance activities, such as CPB Global Actions.
• Provide support in other safety, health, and environmental areas requiring compliance and governance considerations.
• Ensure consistent application of project health and safety systems through site reviews and support for safety and operational personnel.
• Assist the Health and Safety Administrator during work overflow periods.

Desired Skills:
• Advanced system knowledge of Power Bi including back end dashboard development (essential)
• Proven application skills using data management systems (ie; Power Bi, SharePoint)
• Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
• Stakeholder Relationships: Build and maintain effective relationships with key stakeholders, fostering collaboration.
• Data Analysis: Possess highly developed analytical and quantitative skills to evaluate complex data and offer recommendations.
• Communication: Strong written and oral communication skills to engage with individuals on various issues.
• Data Proficiency: Proficient in data analysis and reporting.
• Versatility: Experience in working with individuals at different organizational levels.
• Adaptability: Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines while remaining flexible.

In return, we offer rewarding careers, genuine opportunities to develop and grow, and a workplace culture that values and recognises effort and contribution.

If you are interested in these roles and meet the above requirements, please apply below.

CPBJH JV is committed to equal employment opportunity (EEO) and actively seeks to remove barriers people may face in gaining a successful position on the West Gate Tunnel Project. We value diversity in our team and people who share our values of authenticity, respect and excellence are encouraged to apply.

Acknowledgement of Country

CSIRO acknowledges the Traditional Owners of the land, sea and waters, of the area that we live and work on across Australia. We acknowledge their continuing connection to their culture and pay our respects to their Elders past and present. View our vision towards reconciliation

Child Safety

CSIRO is committed to the safety and wellbeing of all children and young people involved in our activities and programs. View our Child Safe Policy .

The Opportunity
• Join CSIRO - Australia's National Science and Innovation Agency!
• Supportive, rewarding, inclusive and truly flexible environment.
• Collaborative, flexible, innovative workplace that values you and your career development

CSIRO is the national science agency that undertakes research to make life better for Australia and Australians.

We seek a highly motivated geospatial scientist/programmer to support the delivery of a large complex suite of projects under the National Bushfire Intelligence Capability (NBIC). NBIC is developing a framework to deliver data products and decision support relevant for state, territory and federal bushfire planning and response agencies.

The role requires large data processing, programming, spatial analysis, and cloud computing skills. The role is based within the Bushfire Analytics team in the CSIRO Environment Business Unit. For the successful candidate, opportunities may emerge over time to provide support for other projects in CSIRO’s Environment Business Unit portfolio of projects.

The Bushfire Analytics team is primarily based in Melbourne and Brisbane, and you will interact with other teams who are located in other CSIRO offices throughout Australia. The role provides the opportunity for continual learning and innovation, and you will work with a highly skilled and diverse team in a collaborative and supportive environment.

Your duties will include:
• Leveraging statistical, physical and process models to inform fuel and fire behaviour prediction such as species distribution, ecosystem dynamics, vegetation growth and fire behaviour modelling.
• Translating science into workflows that utilise technologies such web APIs and remote sensing data archives.

The role will also require:
• Innovative design, development and adaptation of experimental methods and systems (some of which may be from beyond traditional bushfire and environmental science disciplines).
• An ability to collaborate with staff from other teams and external stake holders to ensure NBIC is meeting their needs and objectives.
• Demonstration of a capacity to communicate scientific research results, including collaborating on presentations and written reports for clients and the scientific community, industry or government.
• Ability to work to deadlines and accepting responsibility for the scheduling and completion of major project activities, including allocating and directing tasks where appropriate.
• Work collaboratively as part of a multi-disciplinary, regionally dispersed research team to perform tasks in support of CSIRO’s scientific objectives.
• Adherence to the spirit and practice of CSIRO’s Values, Code of Conduct, Health, Safety and Environment procedures and policy, diversity initiatives and Making Safety Personal goals.
• Other duties as directed.

Location: Melbourne, Brisbane or Canberra

Salary: AU$105,806 – AU$114,500 per annum + up to 15.4% superannuation

Tenure: Specified term of 2 years

Reference: 93634

To be considered you will need:

Essential

Under CSIRO policy only those who meet all essential criteria can be appointed.
• Postgraduate education and/or equivalent experience in Science, including computer science.
• Strong quantitative skills and a demonstrated ability to process, analyse and interpret large and complex spatial datasets.
• Experience in the use and role of remote sensing and spatial data in multi-disciplinary projects that report on environmental processes.
• Proficiency in computer programming and scripting languages (specifically Python and/or R) for automating workflows and the processing of geospatial data, including an ability to demonstrate skills in software version control.
• An ability to use a broad range of computing platforms, including high performance and commercial cloud platforms.
• Sound written and oral communication skills, including the production of scientific reports.
Desirable:
• Established knowledge and understanding of bushfire behaviour modelling, risk analysis and mitigation.
• A track record of publication in peer-reviewed journals articles.
• Experience developing custom tools using geographic information systems (GIS) such as ESRI ArcGIS and QGIS.

For full details about this role please view the Position Description

Eligibility

Eligibility

Applications for this position are open to all Australian/New Zealand Citizens, Australian Permanent residents or Australian Temporary residents with full work rights without the requirement for sponsorship from CSIRO for the duration of the specified term contract.

Appointment to this role is subject to the provision of a national police check and may be subject to other security/medical/character requirements.

…

How To Apply

Please apply online and provide a cover letter and CV that best demonstrate your motivation and ability to meet the selection criteria and key duties.

Please note that this position was initially advertised a couple of months back and has been re-advertised with enhanced requirements. If you have already applied for this position when it was initially advertised, please feel free to refer to the amended Position Description for the changes in the role, however, you do not need to re-apply, as your application would already be in our database.

Flexible Working Arrangements

We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work.

Diversity and Inclusion

We are working hard to recruit people representing the diversity across our society, and ensure that all our people feel supported to do their best work and feel empowered to let their ideas flourish.

About CSIRO

At CSIRO Australia's national science agency, we solve the greatest challenges through innovative science and technology. We put the safety and wellbeing of our people above all else and earn trust everywhere because we only deal in facts. We collaborate widely and generously and deliver solutions with real impact.

CSIRO is committed to values-based leadership to inspire performance and unlock the potential of our people.

CSIRO is committed to the safety and wellbeing of all children and young people involved in our activities and programs, whether we are undertaking research, engaging with the public or nurturing future scientists in person or online. Source – CSIRO Child Safe policy 2023

Join us and start creating tomorrow today!

How to Apply

Please apply on-line and provide a cover letter and CV that best demonstrate your motivation and ability to meet the requirements of this role.

About Tabcorp

Tabcorp is Australia's leading gambling entertainment company, renowned for our world-class brands including TAB, Sky Racing, and MAX. It’s an exciting moment in our history – a new era of Tabcorp. We’re bringing industry-leading products and services to our customers, leading with integrity, and creating value for our shareholders and industry partners by breaking into new horizons.

What You'll Do

As a Senior Digital Analyst you’ll join our Data & Analytics Centre of Excellence which is a game-changing hub of innovation and insights that is tasked with developing cutting-edge data and analytics solutions that tackle complex business challenges head-on.

Your role will be to partner with our Digital and Product teams to champion digital data analytics, support major digital initiatives and deliver insights that improve performance and create leading products and services. Therefore, you will:
• develop digital insights leading to new and improved app and website features;
• partner with developers on Adobe and Google Analytics initiatives;
• drive digital engagement and growth through personalisation and tagging strategies;
• analyze data to identify trends, understand user journeys, improve conversion funnels, and identify drop-off / pain points for customers; and
• lead A/B Testing to evaluate effectiveness of digital marketing, web/app changes and conversion rate tests.

What you’ll bring

As a Senior Digital Analyst, you’ll have demonstrated experience in digital analytics role where you have developed a range of skills and experiences including:
• strong experience developing strategies to drive digital engagement and growth across websites and apps;
• experience in data analytics and exposure to website and mobile app development processes;
• strong experience with Adobe Analytics or equivalent software (such as Google Analytics);
• experience partnering with a range of stakeholders including product teams and software developers; and
• ability to write and develop specifications for web and app tracking implementation.

Beyond technical expertise, you’ll be a passionate and attentive self-starter with a proven ability to deliver results. Operating in our fast-paced, flexible, and team-oriented environment, you'll need excellent communication and relationship management skills to effectively engage with both technical and non-technical audiences.

What You'll Get:

By joining our dynamic team, you will not only be part of redefining the future of our industry but will also enjoy a range of rewards and benefits, including:
• Hybrid working environment, offering flexibility and work-life balance.

Description

Who We Are:

New Aim is Australia's largest and fastest-growing private ecommerce company. Since 2005, we've evolved from marketplace seller to ecommerce enabler, ranking among the 'Top 500 Private Companies' in Australia.

We're reimagining the possibilities of ecommerce, introducing new technologies to democratise business ownership, and inspiring entirely new categories of business. Our channel coverage represents more than 60% of Australia's total retail sales. Through our B2B retail marketplace, Dropshipzone, we're creating an ecosystem that enables thousands of SMEs to start and scale with ecommerce.

Role Title - Head of Data and Analytics

The Head of Data Analytics will be responsible for leading and managing New Aim's data analytics function. This role involves developing and executing a comprehensive data strategy as well as managing a team of data analysts, data scientists and data engineers, and collaborating with various departments to drive data-driven decision-making. The Head of Data Analytics plays a crucial role in using advanced analytics to translate data into actionable insights that contribute to the organization's strategic goals and growth. If you are a visionary leader with a passion for analytics, insights generation, and driving business outcomes, we invite you to apply and join our New Aim team.

The Exciting Role:

1. Data Strategy and Planning:

Develop and implement a data analytics strategy aligned with the organization's business objectives.

Define data analytics OKRs, KPIs, and performance metrics.

Establish data governance and data management practices to ensure data quality, security, and compliance.

2. Team Leadership:

Build and manage a high-performing team of data analysts, data scientists, and data engineers.

Provide leadership, mentorship, and professional development opportunities for team members.

Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning within the data analytics team.

3. Data Analysis and Insights:

Oversee the collection, integration, and analysis of data from various sources.

Utilize advanced analytics techniques, machine learning, statistical methods and AI to derive actionable insights.

Innovative problem solver who can leverage advanced analytics techniques to generate unique insights and outcomes, consistently pushing the boundaries of conventional data analysis to offer a fresh perspective and creative solutions that elevate the capabilities of our data team.

Present findings and insights to key stakeholders, translating complex data into understandable, actionable recommendations.

4. Data Infrastructure and Technology:

Evaluate, select, and implement data analytics tools and technologies to support the team's objectives.

Manage data storage, processing, and visualization platforms.

Ensure the scalability and reliability of data infrastructure.

What You'll Bring:

Candidates for this role should have 7+ years of experience in data analytics, including 3+ years in a leadership or managerial role.

The Head of Data Analytics plays a critical role in harnessing the power of data to drive business growth and innovation. This position requires a combination of technical expertise, leadership skills, and a strategic mindset to transform data into a valuable asset for the organization

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics).

Master's degree or Ph.D. (preferred) in a related field.

Proven experience in data analytics, data science, or a related role.

Proven record of public speaking and presenting AI and advanced analytics related topics at reputable industry conferences

Strong leadership and team management skills.

Proficiency in data analytics tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL).

Strong knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).

Familiarity with data warehousing and cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Databricks).

Excellent communication, presentation, and stakeholder management skills.

Understanding of data privacy and security regulations.

• Hawthorn location

• Free on-site parking (and coffee)

• Close to public transport – within 15 minutes' walk from the train station

• Generous employee discounts on over 6,000 products

• Company funded events, including Christmas event celebrations, birthday celebrations etc.

• Strong communication skills (written, verbal & interpersonal)

This is a unique opportunity to truly make your mark & contribute to the success of the iconic Bulla Dairy Foods brand. If you think you have the ability to successfully drive improvement in an SAP environment, please apply now to join our team!

Benefits

What We Offer: In return for your dedication and expertise, we offer:
• * Competitive remuneration and benefits

• The chance to engage in purposeful work within a values-driven organisation

Company Description

illion is the leading independent provider of trusted data and analytics products and services in Australia and New Zealand. illion leverages its consumer and commercial credit registries to provide end-to-end customer management solutions to clients in the financial services, telecommunications, utilities and government sectors.

Product Analysts are responsible for assisting Product Managers in maintaining a competitive and customer-oriented product suite, supporting the complete product lifecycle for a range of products targeted across organisations risk life stages.

This position works in partnership with a variety of stakeholders across the business including Business Analysts, Project Managers, IT Developers, Sales, Data, Finance and Customer Support to develop, implement, monitor and support of Products.

Job Description

Assist in managing the End-to-End Product lifecycle of key products, including:
• Research and analysis to help inform product decisions.
• Monitor customer usage, behaviour and trends, developing a deep, data centric knowledge of our customers.
• Track product performance against revenue goals, industry standards and competitors, liaising with other business units to gather information.
• Identify and define product features, gaps and user journeys, focusing on customer needs.
• Help maintain the enhancement backlog, balancing customer needs with competing business priorities.
• Work closely with Business Analysts to understand, analyse and document business requirements and acceptance criteria, clearly articulating the ‘why’ and ensuring the product vision is captured.
• Attend project stand-ups and meetings, providing context and clarification on product requirements and objectives.
• Participate in UAT (User Acceptance Testing) and PVT (Production Verification Testing) activities.

Qualifications
• Using data to support decision making.
• Experience working in both agile and waterfall environments.
• Tertiary qualification in a business or quantitative discipline.
• Competency to perform basic SQL queries (Microsoft SQL Management Studio).
• An adequate understanding of database structures.
• Confident use of Microsoft Office – Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint and Word.
• Analytical capability and problems solving – using data to inform decisions.
• Strong relationship and influencing skills – to deliver outcomes and satisfy customer needs.

Additional Information

Some of our perks
• Flexibility and Remote Working Options
• Gifted Leave, Purchased Leave, Public Holiday Swap and Paid Volunteer Leave
• Paid Parental Leave
• Novated Leasing and Corporate Discounts (ie. Health Insurance)
• Education Assistance and dedicated time for professional development as part of your role
• Free Employee Assistance Programme, Free Flu Shots and Subsidised Gym Memberships.

illion’s values

Wonder what if

We wonder on many levels. About ideas. And about how others see them. We listen with curiosity. Obsess the numbers. And embrace new ways to make data, make a difference

We’re good eggs

Everything we do is built on integrity. We hold ourselves to high standards. And higher principles. We act with good intentions. Taking every opportunity to be that little bit better.

Human. Kind

People are the hart of our products, processes and culture. Our relationships are a gift. We’re inclusive. Measuring the impact of our actions on other’s first. Kindness and humanity prevail.

We all add up

How to Apply

To apply, please click “Apply Now” button and we will be in touch shortly.

Here at illion, we value diversity and inclusion and believe that we are able to grow and learn better together with a diverse team of employees. By joining illion you'll be part of an inclusive culture that celebrates a diversity of cultures, skill sets, educations and opinions. What's in it for you?
We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our EY Data and Analytics team ideally in our Melbourne and Sydney offices but can also be based in any of the major Australian cities. Working with a number of high profile clients this role is offered on a flexible, full-time basis.

You will help shape, change, and deliver a data management roadmap to improve and enhance the value and re-usability of data, through modern and evolving data management practices and frameworks.

As a Data Analyst, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives, you will work with a diverse range of stakeholders and data teams to uplift the current data quality management capabilities of a number of different high profile client groups.

What we're looking for:
Translating business questions to data and analysis requirements; carry out analysis, visualization and presentation.
Performing ad-hoc analysis to solve business problems and support decisions.

Run human centred design sessions with end-users.
Communicating and influencing stakeholders.

Skills and attributes for success:

Curious and business outcome focused with an ability to break down a complex problem and work out how to solve it.

Have knowledge of SQL, with knowledge of Python an advantage.
Familiarity with Power BI and ideally data manipulation tools (e.g. Alteryx and Daraiku).

The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider. Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $90,000 including 11% superannuation.

Our culture believes in Powering Your Potential. We provide global opportunities to develop your career, make your community a better place and work with today’s most innovative thinkers to solve the world’s toughest problems.

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

THIS ROLE IS BASED IN BANGKOK, THAILAND (RELOCATION PROVIDED)

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

The Supply Analytics team is a team of creative entrepreneurs that develop solutions for Agoda’s accommodation partners and promote Agoda’s top and bottom-line growth. We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda’s unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we build new channels to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.

The Opportunity:

The role sits within the Supply Analytics team under Supply department, where new business ideas, and partnership types are incubated and scaled. We are looking for a BI Analyst whose main focus areas are providing visibility and insights for people-related issues through Business Intelligence tools like Tableau and SQL, managing data warehouses, building ETL processes, and helping build other tools to optimize the business. This role will be involved in strategic projects and work closely with commercial owners and business stakeholders, using data to identify and translate business needs and opportunities into actionable initiatives. You will report directly into the Manager, Senior Manager, or Associate Director of Supply Analytics.

In this Role, you’ll get to:
• Translate internal briefs into analytical projects (to include refining the initial brief and asking the ‘right questions’, working through potential hypotheses and storyboarding the output)
• Use and analyze data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and present statistically strong analysis to a wide range of business stakeholders
• Proactively identify opportunities for growth within supply and the wider business
• Drive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving organizational efficiency and shaping Agoda supply
• Identify, support, and lead projects aimed at scaling up the way the Supply organization leverages on data, insights, and intelligence
• Automate manual operational processes and present back on time savings gained through modernization of business operations

What you’ll Need to Succeed:
• 5+ years of experience as a BI Analyst in analytics/insights/strategy
• Bachelor’s degree ideally in a business or quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance)
• Hands-on experience with BI & analytics tools (SQL, Tableau, Metabase or PowerBI)
• Experience in conducting A/B testing experimentation (a plus)
• Good stakeholder management experience. Comfortable presenting to senior leadership and C-suite
• Strong experience in finding data insights and provide business recommendation to the business
• A good understanding of statistical modelling knowledge or any machine learning technique knowledge is a plus (regression, logistic regression, random forest, etc.)
• Excellent skills in presenting and storytelling.
• A hacker’s mindset – the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototyping
• Excellent communicator with superior written, verbal, presentation and interpersonal communication skills
• Data driven in both decision making and performance measurement
• Extreme comfort in ambiguous, fast-paced environment
• Ability to multi-task, prioritize and coordinate resources

It’s Great if you Have:
• Travel industry / e-commerce / tech / consulting experience
